guiQt.view

guiQt.view module: PyQt5 view components for uHDR GUI application.

This module implements the View component of the Model-View-Controller (MVC) architecture pattern used in uHDR. It contains PyQt5 widgets and interfaces that handle user interaction and visual presentation of HDR image editing tools.

The module provides:

  • Main application window with menu system and docking
  • Image gallery with grid layout and pagination
  • HDR image editing controls and parameter adjustment
  • Tone curve editing with B-spline visualization
  • Color space editing in LCH coordinates
  • Lightness masking for selective adjustments
  • Geometry transformation controls
  • Image information and metadata display
  • Aesthetics analysis visualization
  • HDR display and external monitor support

Key View Classes: AppView: Main application window with menus and docking ImageGalleryView: Grid-based image gallery with pagination EditImageView: Complete HDR editing interface ImageInfoView: Image metadata and information display ToneCurveView: B-spline tone curve editing with matplotlib LchColorSelectorView: LCH color space selection interface HDRviewerView: HDR display controls and preview ImageAestheticsView: Color palette and aesthetics visualization

Widget Utilities: ImageWidgetView: Basic image display widget FigureWidget: Matplotlib integration for curve editing AdvanceSliderView: Enhanced slider with auto/reset functionality AdvanceLineEdit: Labeled line edit widget AdvanceCheckBox: Labeled checkbox widget

The views handle user interaction events and delegate business logic to their associated controllers while providing visual feedback and real-time parameter adjustment capabilities.

  19# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  20# --- Package hdrGUI ---------------------------------------------------------
  21# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  22"""
  23guiQt.view module: PyQt5 view components for uHDR GUI application.
  24
  25This module implements the View component of the Model-View-Controller (MVC)
  26architecture pattern used in uHDR. It contains PyQt5 widgets and interfaces
  27that handle user interaction and visual presentation of HDR image editing tools.
  28
  29The module provides:
  30- Main application window with menu system and docking
  31- Image gallery with grid layout and pagination  
  32- HDR image editing controls and parameter adjustment
  33- Tone curve editing with B-spline visualization
  34- Color space editing in LCH coordinates
  35- Lightness masking for selective adjustments
  36- Geometry transformation controls
  37- Image information and metadata display
  38- Aesthetics analysis visualization
  39- HDR display and external monitor support
  40
  41Key View Classes:
  42    AppView: Main application window with menus and docking
  43    ImageGalleryView: Grid-based image gallery with pagination
  44    EditImageView: Complete HDR editing interface
  45    ImageInfoView: Image metadata and information display
  46    ToneCurveView: B-spline tone curve editing with matplotlib
  47    LchColorSelectorView: LCH color space selection interface
  48    HDRviewerView: HDR display controls and preview
  49    ImageAestheticsView: Color palette and aesthetics visualization
  50
  51Widget Utilities:
  52    ImageWidgetView: Basic image display widget
  53    FigureWidget: Matplotlib integration for curve editing
  54    AdvanceSliderView: Enhanced slider with auto/reset functionality
  55    AdvanceLineEdit: Labeled line edit widget
  56    AdvanceCheckBox: Labeled checkbox widget
  57
  58The views handle user interaction events and delegate business logic
  59to their associated controllers while providing visual feedback and
  60real-time parameter adjustment capabilities.
  61"""
  62
  63# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  64# --- Import ------------------------------------------------------------------
  65# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  67from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QSplitter, QFrame, QSlider, QCheckBox, QGroupBox
  68from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QHBoxLayout, QVBoxLayout, QGridLayout, QLayout, QScrollArea, QFormLayout
  69from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QPushButton, QTextEdit,QLineEdit, QComboBox, QSpinBox
  70from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QAction, QProgressBar, QDialog
  71from PyQt5.QtGui import QPixmap, QImage, QDoubleValidator
  72from PyQt5.QtCore import Qt
  73from PyQt5 import QtCore, QtWidgets 
  74
  75from matplotlib.backends.backend_qt5agg import FigureCanvasQTAgg as FigureCanvas

  77

  82import hdrCore.image, hdrCore.processing
  83import math, enum
  84import functools

  90# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  91# --- class ImageWidgetView(QWidget) -------------------------------------------------------
  92# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  93class ImageWidgetView(QWidget):
  94    """
  95    Basic image display widget for showing numpy arrays or HDR images.
  96    
  97    Provides a simple image viewer widget that can display color data
  98    as QPixmap with automatic scaling and aspect ratio preservation.
  99    Handles clipping and conversion from floating-point HDR data to
 100    8-bit RGB for Qt display.
 101    
 102    Attributes:
 103        controller: Reference to controlling ImageWidgetController
 104        label (QLabel): Qt label widget for pixmap display
 105        imagePixmap (QPixmap): Current pixmap for display
 106    
 107    Methods:
 108        resize: Update widget and pixmap scaling
 109        resizeEvent: Handle Qt resize events
 110        setPixmap: Set image from numpy array with preprocessing
 111        setQPixmap: Set pre-processed QPixmap directly
 112        emptyImageColorData: Generate default placeholder image [Static]
 113    """
 114
 115    def __init__(self,controller,colorData = None):
 116        """
 117        Initialize image widget view.
 118        
 119        Args:
 120            controller: Parent ImageWidgetController instance
 121            colorData (numpy.ndarray, optional): Initial image data to display
 122        """
 123        super().__init__()
 124        self.controller = controller
 125        self.label = QLabel(self)   # create a QtLabel for pixmap
 126        if not isinstance(colorData, np.ndarray): colorData = ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData()
 127        # self.colorData = colorData  # image content attributes           
 128        self.setPixmap(colorData)  
 129
 130    def resize(self):
 131        """
 132        Update widget and pixmap scaling to current size.
 133        
 134        Resizes the internal label and scales the pixmap to fit the widget
 135        while preserving aspect ratio.
 136        """
 137        self.label.resize(self.size())
 138        self.label.setPixmap(self.imagePixmap.scaled(self.size(),Qt.KeepAspectRatio))
 139
 140    def resizeEvent(self,event):
 141        """
 142        Handle Qt resize events.
 143        
 144        Args:
 145            event: Qt resize event object
 146        """
 147        self.resize()
 148        super().resizeEvent(event)
 149
 150    def setPixmap(self,colorData):
 151        """
 152        Set image from numpy array with HDR to sRGB conversion.
 153        
 154        Converts floating-point HDR image data to 8-bit RGB for Qt display.
 155        Applies clipping to [0,1] range and handles format conversion.
 156        
 157        Args:
 158            colorData (numpy.ndarray): RGB image data (height, width, 3)
 159            
 160        Returns:
 161            QPixmap: Generated pixmap for display
 162        """
 163        if not isinstance(colorData, np.ndarray): 
 164            colorData = ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData()
 165        # self.colorData = colorData
 166        height, width, channel = colorData.shape   # compute pixmap
 167        bytesPerLine = channel * width
 168        # clip
 169        colorData[colorData>1.0] = 1.0
 170        colorData[colorData<0.0] = 0.0
 171
 172        qImg = QImage((colorData*255).astype(np.uint8), width, height, bytesPerLine, QImage.Format_RGB888) # QImage
 173        self.imagePixmap = QPixmap.fromImage(qImg)
 174        self.resize()
 175
 176        return self.imagePixmap
 177
 178    def setQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
 179        """
 180        Set pre-processed QPixmap directly.
 181        
 182        Args:
 183            qPixmap (QPixmap): Pre-processed pixmap for display
 184        """
 185        self.imagePixmap = qPixmap
 186        self.resize()
 187
 188    def emptyImageColorData(): 
 189        """
 190        Generate default placeholder image for empty display.
 191        
 192        Returns:
 193            numpy.ndarray: Gray placeholder image (90x160x3) 
 194        """
 195        return np.ones((90,160,3))*(220/255) 
 196# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 197# --- class FigureWidget(FigureCanvas ------------------------------------------------------
 198# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 199class FigureWidget(FigureCanvas):
 200    """
 201    Matplotlib figure widget for embedding plots in Qt interface.
 202    
 203    Provides matplotlib integration for displaying curves, histograms,
 204    and other plots within the Qt GUI. Used primarily for tone curve
 205    visualization and editing.
 206    
 207    Attributes:
 208        fig (Figure): Matplotlib figure object
 209        axes: Matplotlib axes for plotting
 210    
 211    Methods:
 212        plot: Draw line plot with specified data and style
 213    """
 214
 215    def __init__(self, parent=None, width=5, height=5, dpi=100):
 216        """
 217        Initialize matplotlib figure widget.
 218        
 219        Args:
 220            parent: Parent Qt widget
 221            width (int): Figure width in inches
 222            height (int): Figure height in inches
 223            dpi (int): Figure resolution in dots per inch
 224        """
 225        # create Figure
 226        self.fig = Figure(figsize=(width, height), dpi=dpi)
 227        self.axes = self.fig.add_subplot(111)
 228        FigureCanvas.__init__(self, self.fig)    # explicite call of super constructor
 229        self.setParent(parent)
 230        FigureCanvas.updateGeometry(self)
 231        self.setMinimumSize(200, 200)
 232
 233    def plot(self,X,Y,mode, clear=False):
 234        """
 235        Draw line plot with specified data and style.
 236        
 237        Args:
 238            X (array-like): X-coordinate data points
 239            Y (array-like): Y-coordinate data points
 240            mode (str): Matplotlib line style (e.g., 'r--', 'b-')
 241            clear (bool): Clear previous plots before drawing
 242        """
 243        if clear: self.axes.clear()
 244        self.axes.plot(X,Y,mode)
 245        try:
 246            self.fig.canvas.draw()
 247        except Exception:
 248            time.sleep(0.5)
 249            self.fig.canvas.draw()
 250
 251# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 252# --- class ImageGalleryView(QSplitter) ----------------------------------------------------
 253# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 254class ImageGalleryView(QSplitter):
 255    """
 256    Grid-based image gallery with pagination and navigation controls.
 257    
 258    Displays multiple images in a configurable grid layout with pagination
 259    support for large image collections. Provides interactive navigation
 260    buttons and supports different grid configurations (1x1, 3x2, 6x4, 9x6).
 261    
 262    Layout Structure:
 263        +-------------------------------------------+
 264        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | \
 265        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
 266        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
 267        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
 268        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
 269        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
 270        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |   >   GridLayout
 271        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
 272        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
 273        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
 274        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
 275        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | /
 276        +-------------------------------------------+  <    splitter
 277        | [<] [1x1][3x2][6x4][9x6][page number] [>] |       [pushButton] HorizontalLayout
 278        +-------------------------------------------+
 279    
 280    Attributes:
 281        controller: Reference to ImageGalleryController
 282        shapeMode: Current grid layout mode (GalleryMode enum)
 283        pageNumber (int): Current page index (0-based)
 284        imagesControllers (list): List of ImageWidgetController instances
 285        images (QFrame): Frame containing image grid
 286        imagesLayout (QGridLayout): Grid layout for images
 287        buttons (QWidget): Navigation button container
 288        pageNumberLabel (QLabel): Current page display
 289    
 290    Methods:
 291        currentPage: Get current page number
 292        changePageNumber: Navigate to different page
 293        updateImages: Refresh image display for current page
 294        updateImage: Update specific image in grid
 295        resetGridLayoutWidgets: Clear current grid widgets
 296        buildGridLayoutWidgets: Create new grid layout
 297        wheelEvent: Handle mouse wheel navigation
 298        mousePressEvent: Handle image selection clicks
 299    """
 300    def __init__(self,controller_=None,shapeMode=None):
 301        """
 302        Initialize image gallery view.
 303        
 304        Args:
 305            controller_: Parent ImageGalleryController instance
 306            shapeMode: Initial grid layout mode (defaults to 3x2)
 307        """
 308        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.__init__(",")")
 309
 310        super().__init__(Qt.Vertical)
 311
 312        self.controller= controller_
 313        self.shapeMode = controller.GalleryMode._3x2 if not shapeMode else shapeMode    # default display mode 
 314        self.pageNumber =0
 315
 316        self.imagesControllers = []
 317
 318        self.images = QFrame()
 319        self.images.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
 320        self.imagesLayout = QGridLayout()
 321        self.images.setLayout(self.imagesLayout)
 322
 323        self.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 324
 325        self.previousPageButton =   QPushButton('<')
 326        self.previousPageButton.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_previousPage)
 327        self._1x1Button =           QPushButton('1x1')
 328        self._1x1Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_1x1)
 329        self._2x1Button =           QPushButton('2x1')
 330        self._2x1Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_2x1)
 331        self._3x2Button =           QPushButton('3x2')
 332        self._3x2Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_3x2)
 333        self._6x4Button =           QPushButton('6x4')
 334        self._6x4Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_6x4)
 335        self._9x6Button =           QPushButton('9x6')
 336        self._9x6Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_9x6)
 337        self.nextPageButton =       QPushButton('>')
 338        self.nextPageButton.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_nextPage)
 339
 340        self.pageNumberLabel = QLabel(str(self.pageNumber)+"/ ...")
 341
 342        self.buttons = QWidget()
 343        self.buttonsLayout = QHBoxLayout()
 344        self.buttons.setLayout(self.buttonsLayout)
 345        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self.previousPageButton)
 346        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._1x1Button)
 347        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._2x1Button)
 348        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._3x2Button)
 349        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._6x4Button)
 350        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._9x6Button)
 351        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self.nextPageButton)
 352
 353        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self.pageNumberLabel)
 354
 355        self.addWidget(self.images)
 356        self.addWidget(self.buttons)
 357        self.setSizes([1525,82])
 358
 359    def currentPage(self): 
 360        """
 361        Get current page number.
 362        
 363        Returns:
 364            int: Current page index (0-based)
 365        """
 366        return self.pageNumber
 367
 368    def changePageNumber(self,step):
 369        """
 370        Navigate to different page with wraparound.
 371        
 372        Changes the current page by the specified step, with automatic
 373        wraparound at the beginning and end of the page range.
 374        
 375        Args:
 376            step (int): Page increment/decrement (+1 for next, -1 for previous)
 377        """
 378        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.changePageNumber(",step,")")
 379
 380        nbImagePerPage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)
 381        maxPage = ((len(self.controller.model.processPipes)-1)//nbImagePerPage) + 1
 382
 383        if len(self.controller.model.processPipes) > 0 :
 384
 385            oldPageNumber = self.pageNumber
 386            if (self.pageNumber+step) > maxPage-1:
 387                self.pageNumber = 0
 388            elif (self.pageNumber+step) <0:
 389                self.pageNumber = maxPage-1
 390            else:
 391                self.pageNumber  = self.pageNumber+step
 392            self.updateImages()
 393            self.controller.model.loadPage(self.pageNumber)
 394            if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.changePageNumber(currentPage:",self.pageNumber," | max page:",maxPage,")")
 395
 396    def updateImages(self):
 397        """
 398        Refresh image display for current page.
 399        
 400        Updates all image widgets in the grid with placeholder content
 401        and refreshes the page number display. Actual images are loaded
 402        asynchronously by the model.
 403        """
 404        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.updateImages(",")")
 405
 406        """ update images content """
 407        nbImagePerPage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)
 408        maxPage = ((len(self.controller.model.processPipes)-1)//nbImagePerPage) + 1
 409        
 410        index=0
 411        for i in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)): 
 412            for j in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)):
 413                # get image controllers                                                                                         
 414                iwc = self.imagesControllers[index]
 415                iwc.view.setPixmap(ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData())                                                 
 416                index +=1                                                                                                                                                                                                           
 417        self.pageNumberLabel.setText(str(self.pageNumber)+"/"+str(maxPage-1))
 418
 419    def updateImage(self, idx, processPipe, filename):
 420        """
 421        Update specific image in grid with loaded content.
 422        
 423        Args:
 424            idx (int): Index of image within current page
 425            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Loaded image processing pipeline
 426            filename (str): Image filename for status display
 427        """
 428        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.updateImage(",")")
 429        imageWidgetController = self.imagesControllers[idx]                                 
 430        imageWidgetController.setImage(processPipe.getImage())
 431        self.controller.parent.statusBar().showMessage("loading of image "+filename+" done!")
 432
 433    def resetGridLayoutWidgets(self):
 434        """
 435        Clear current grid layout widgets.
 436        
 437        Removes all image widgets from the grid layout and cleans up
 438        memory by deleting widget references.
 439        """
 440        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.resetGridLayoutWidgets(",")")
 441
 442        for w in self.imagesControllers:
 443            self.imagesLayout.removeWidget(w.view)
 444            w.view.deleteLater()
 445        self.imagesControllers = []
 446
 447    def buildGridLayoutWidgets(self):
 448        """
 449        Create new grid layout widgets based on current shape mode.
 450        
 451        Generates ImageWidgetController instances for each position in
 452        the grid and adds them to the layout with proper positioning.
 453        """
 454        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.buildGridLayoutWidgets(",")")
 455
 456        imageIndex = 0
 457        for i in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)): 
 458            for j in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)):
 459                iwc = controller.ImageWidgetController(id=imageIndex)
 460                self.imagesControllers.append(iwc)
 461                self.imagesLayout.addWidget(iwc.view,i,j)
 462                imageIndex +=1
 463
 464    def wheelEvent(self, event):
 465        """
 466        Handle mouse wheel navigation between pages.
 467        
 468        Args:
 469            event: Qt wheel event with scroll direction
 470        """
 471        if pref.verbose: print(" [EVENT] >> ImageGalleryView.wheelEvent(",")")
 472
 473        if event.angleDelta().y() < 0 :     
 474            self.changePageNumber(+1)
 475            if self.shapeMode == controller.GalleryMode._1x1 : 
 476                self.controller.selectImage(0)
 477
 478        else :                              
 479            self.changePageNumber(-1)
 480            if self.shapeMode == controller.GalleryMode._1x1 : 
 481                self.controller.selectImage(0)
 482        event.accept()
 483
 484    def mousePressEvent(self,event):
 485        """
 486        Handle image selection clicks.
 487        
 488        Determines which image was clicked based on mouse position
 489        and notifies the controller for selection handling.
 490        
 491        Args:
 492            event: Qt mouse press event with position
 493        """
 494        if pref.verbose: print(" [EVENT] >> ImageGalleryView.mousePressEvent(",")")
 495
 496        # self.childAt(event.pos()) return QLabel .parent() should be ImageWidget object
 497        if isinstance(self.childAt(event.pos()).parent(),ImageWidgetView):
 498            id = self.childAt(event.pos()).parent().controller.id()
 499        else:
 500            id = -1
 501
 502        if id != -1: # an image is clicked select it!
 503            self.controller.selectImage(id)
 504        event.accept()

 508class AppView(QMainWindow):
 509    """
 510    Main application window for uHDR HDR image editing software.
 511    
 512    Provides the primary user interface for uHDR with comprehensive menu system,
 513    dockable panels, and central image gallery. Manages window geometry, screen
 514    configuration, and application-wide functionality including file operations,
 515    HDR display management, and export capabilities.
 516    
 517    Window Structure:
 518    - Central Widget: Image gallery with pagination
 519    - Right Dock: Multi-panel interface (Edit/Info/Aesthetics)
 520    - Menu Bar: File, Display HDR, Export, Dock, Preferences
 521    - Status Bar: Real-time operation feedback
 522    
 523    Attributes:
 524        controller (AppController): Parent application controller
 525        imageGalleryController (ImageGalleryController): Central gallery management
 526        dock (MultiDockController): Right panel controller
 527        topContainer (QWidget): Central widget container
 528        menuExport (QAction): Export menu action reference
 529        menuExportAll (QAction): Export all menu action reference
 530    
 531    Methods:
 532        getImageGalleryController: Access gallery controller
 533        resizeEvent: Handle window resize events
 534        setWindowGeometry: Configure window size and position
 535        buildFileMenu: Create file operations menu
 536        buildPreferences: Create HDR display preferences menu
 537        buildDisplayHDR: Create HDR display menu
 538        buildExport: Create export functionality menu
 539        buildDockMenu: Create dock panel switching menu
 540        closeEvent: Handle application shutdown
 541    """
 542    def __init__(self, _controller = None, shapeMode=None, HDRcontroller=None):
 543        """
 544        Initialize main application window.
 545        
 546        Args:
 547            _controller (AppController): Parent application controller
 548            shapeMode: Initial gallery layout mode
 549            HDRcontroller: HDR display controller reference
 550        """
 551        super().__init__()
 552        # --------------------
 553        scale = 0.8
 554        # --------------------   
 555        # attributes
 556        self.controller = _controller
 557        self.setWindowGeometry(scale=scale)
 558        self.setWindowTitle('uHDR - Rmi Cozot (c) 2020-2021')      # title  
 559        self.statusBar().showMessage('Welcome to uHDR!')         # status bar
 560
 561        self.topContainer = QWidget()
 562        self.topLayout = QHBoxLayout()
 563
 564        self.imageGalleryController = controller.ImageGalleryController(self)
 565
 566        self.topLayout.addWidget(self.imageGalleryController.view)
 567
 568        self.topContainer.setLayout(self.topLayout)
 569        self.setCentralWidget(self.topContainer)
 570        # ----------------------------------
 571        self.dock = controller.MultiDockController(self, HDRcontroller)
 572        self.addDockWidget(Qt.RightDockWidgetArea,self.dock.view)
 573        self.resizeDocks([self.dock.view],[int(self.controller.screenSize[0].width()*scale//4)],Qt.Horizontal)
 574
 575        # ----------------------------------
 576        # build menu
 577        self.buildFileMenu()
 578        self.buildDockMenu()
 579        self.buildDisplayHDR()
 580        self.buildExport()
 581        self.buildPreferences()

 601    def setWindowGeometry(self, scale=0.8):
 602        """
 603        Configure window size and position based on available displays.
 604        
 605        Automatically detects multiple displays and positions window on
 606        secondary display if available, otherwise uses primary display.
 607        
 608        Args:
 609            scale (float): Window scaling factor (default 0.8)
 610        """
 611        displayCoord = QDesktopWidget().screenGeometry(1)
 612        if len(self.controller.screenSize) > 1:
 613            width, height = self.controller.screenSize[1].width(), self.controller.screenSize[1].height()
 614        else:
 615            width, height = self.controller.screenSize[0].width(), self.controller.screenSize[0].height()
 616
 617        self.setGeometry(displayCoord.left(), displayCoord.top()+50, math.floor(width*scale), math.floor(height*scale))
 618        self.showMaximized()

 620    def buildFileMenu(self):
 621        """
 622        Create file operations menu with directory selection, save, and quit.
 623        
 624        Menu Items:
 625        - Select directory (Ctrl+O): Choose working directory
 626        - Save (Ctrl+S): Save ProcessPipe metadata 
 627        - Quit (Ctrl+Q): Exit application with cleanup
 628        """
 629        menubar = self.menuBar()# get menubar
 630        fileMenu = menubar.addMenu('&File')# file menu
 631
 632        selectDir = QAction('&Select directory', self)        
 633        selectDir.setShortcut('Ctrl+O')
 634        selectDir.setStatusTip('[File] select a directory')
 635        selectDir.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackSelectDir)
 636        fileMenu.addAction(selectDir)
 637
 638        selectSave = QAction('&Save', self)        
 639        selectSave.setShortcut('Ctrl+S')
 640        selectSave.setStatusTip('[File] saving processpipe metadata')
 641        selectSave.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackSave)
 642        fileMenu.addAction(selectSave)
 643
 644        quit = QAction('&Quit', self)        
 645        quit.setShortcut('Ctrl+Q')
 646        quit.setStatusTip('[File] saving updates and quit')
 647        quit.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackQuit)
 648        fileMenu.addAction(quit)

 650    def buildPreferences(self):
 651        """
 652        Create HDR display preferences menu with dynamic display selection.
 653        
 654        Automatically generates menu items for each configured HDR display
 655        from preferences, allowing runtime switching between different HDR
 656        monitor configurations.
 657        """
 658
 659        menubar = self.menuBar()# get menubar
 660        prefMenu = menubar.addMenu('&Preferences')# file menu
 661
 662        displayList = pref.getHDRdisplays().keys()
 663
 664        # function for callback
 665        def cbd(tag): 
 666            pref.setHDRdisplay(tag)
 667            self.statusBar().showMessage("swithcing HDR Display to: "+tag+"!")
 668            self.menuExport.setText('&Export to '+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag'])
 669            self.menuExportAll.setText('&Export All to '+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag'])        
 670
 671        prefDisplays = []
 672        for i,d in enumerate(displayList):
 673            if d != 'none':
 674                prefDisplay = QAction('&Set display to '+d, self) 
 675                p_cbd = functools.partial(cbd, d)
 676                prefDisplay.triggered.connect(p_cbd)
 677                prefMenu.addAction(prefDisplay)
 678

 778# --- class ImageInfoView(QSplitter) -------------------------------------------------------
 779# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 780class ImageInfoView(QSplitter):
 781    """
 782    Image information and metadata display panel.
 783    
 784    Provides comprehensive display of image metadata including EXIF data,
 785    technical parameters, and user-defined tags. Supports interactive editing
 786    of custom metadata fields for workflow management and image classification.
 787    
 788    Layout Structure:
 789    - Top: Image preview widget
 790    - Bottom: Scrollable metadata form with:
 791      * Technical metadata (name, path, size, dynamic range, etc.)
 792      * EXIF data (exposure, ISO, camera, lens, etc.)
 793      * User-defined workflow tags (organized by groups)
 794    
 795    Attributes:
 796        controller (ImageInfoController): Parent controller reference
 797        imageWidgetController (ImageWidgetController): Image preview controller
 798        layout (QFormLayout): Metadata fields layout
 799        imageName, imagePath, imageSize, etc.: Technical metadata widgets
 800        userDefinedTags (list[AdvanceCheckBox]): Custom metadata checkboxes
 801        scroll (QScrollArea): Scrollable container for metadata fields
 802    
 803    Methods:
 804        setProcessPipe: Update display with new image and metadata
 805        metadataChange: Handle user changes to custom metadata
 806    """
 807    def __init__(self, _controller):
 808        """
 809        Initialize image info view with metadata form.
 810        
 811        Args:
 812            _controller (ImageInfoController): Parent controller instance
 813        """
 814        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageInfoView.__init__(",")")
 815
 816        super().__init__(Qt.Vertical)
 817
 818        self.controller = _controller
 819
 820        self.imageWidgetController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
 821
 822        self.layout = QFormLayout()
 823
 824        # ---------------------------------------------------
 825        self.imageName =            AdvanceLineEdit(" name:", " ........ ",             self.layout, callBack=None)
 826        self.imagePath =            AdvanceLineEdit(" path:", " ........ ",             self.layout, callBack=None)
 827        self.imageSize =            AdvanceLineEdit(" size (pixel):", ".... x .... ",   self.layout, callBack=None)
 828        self.imageDynamicRange =    AdvanceLineEdit(" dynamic range (f-stops)", " ........ ", self.layout, callBack=None)
 829        self.colorSpace =           AdvanceLineEdit(" color space:", " ........ ",      self.layout, callBack=None)
 830        self.imageType =            AdvanceLineEdit(" type:", " ........ ",             self.layout, callBack=None)                     
 831        self.imageBPS =             AdvanceLineEdit(" bits per sample:", " ........ ",  self.layout, callBack=None)
 832        self.imageExpoTime =        AdvanceLineEdit(" exposure time:", " ........ ",    self.layout, callBack=None)
 833        self.imageFNumber =         AdvanceLineEdit("f-number:", " ........ ",          self.layout, callBack=None)          
 834        self.imageISO =             AdvanceLineEdit(" ISO:", " ........ ",              self.layout, callBack=None)           
 835        self.imageCamera =          AdvanceLineEdit(" camera:", " ........ ",           self.layout, callBack=None)      
 836        self.imageSoftware =        AdvanceLineEdit(" software:", " ........ ",         self.layout, callBack=None)      
 837        self.imageLens =            AdvanceLineEdit(" lens:", " ........ ",             self.layout, callBack=None)
 838        self.imageFocalLength =     AdvanceLineEdit(" focal length:", " ........ ",     self.layout, callBack=None)
 839        # ---------------------------------------------------
 840        # ---------------------------------------------------
 841        line = QFrame()
 842        line.setFrameShape(QFrame.HLine)
 843        self.layout.addRow(line)
 844        # ---------------------------------------------------
 845        #  user defined tags
 846        # --------------------------------------------------
 847        userDefinedTags = hdrCore.metadata.tags()
 848        tagRootName = userDefinedTags.getTagsRootName()
 849        listOfTags = userDefinedTags.tags[tagRootName]
 850        self.userDefinedTags = []
 851        for tagGroup in listOfTags:
 852            groupKey = list(tagGroup.keys())[0]
 853            tagLeafs = tagGroup[groupKey]
 854            for tag in tagLeafs.items():
 855                self.userDefinedTags.append( AdvanceCheckBox(self,groupKey, tag[0], False, self.layout))
 856            line = QFrame()
 857            line.setFrameShape(QFrame.HLine)
 858            self.layout.addRow(line)
 859        # --------------------------------------------------
 860
 861
 862        self.layout.setSizeConstraint(QLayout.SetMinAndMaxSize)
 863
 864        self.scroll = QScrollArea()
 865        self.scroll.setVerticalScrollBarPolicy(Qt.ScrollBarAlwaysOn)
 866        self.container = QLabel()
 867        self.container.setLayout(self.layout)
 868        self.scroll.setWidget(self.container)
 869        self.scroll.setWidgetResizable(True)
 870
 871        self.addWidget(self.imageWidgetController.view)
 872        self.addWidget(self.scroll)
 873        self.setSizes([60,40])
 874
 875    def setProcessPipe(self,processPipe): 
 876        """
 877        Update display with new image and populate all metadata fields.
 878        
 879        Extracts comprehensive metadata from the ProcessPipe's image including
 880        EXIF data, technical parameters, and user-defined tags. Updates all
 881        form fields and checkboxes to reflect current image state.
 882        
 883        Args:
 884            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline containing image with metadata
 885            
 886        Returns:
 887            Result of imageWidgetController.setImage() operation
 888        """
 889        image_ = processPipe.getImage()
 890        # ---------------------------------------------------
 891        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageInfoView.setImage(",image_.name,")")
 892        if image_.metadata.metadata['filename'] != None: self.imageName.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['filename'])
 893        else: self.imageName.setText(" ........ ")
 894        if image_.metadata.metadata['path'] != None: self.imagePath.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['path'])
 895        else: self.imagePath.setText(" ........ ")
 896        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Image Width'] != None: self.imageSize.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Image Width'])+" x "+ str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Image Height']))
 897        else: self.imageSize.setText(" ........ ")
 898        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Dynamic Range (stops)'] != None: self.imageDynamicRange.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Dynamic Range (stops)']))
 899        else: self.imageDynamicRange.setText(" ........ ")
 900        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Color Space'] != None: self.colorSpace.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Color Space'])
 901        else: self.imageName.setText(" ........ ")
 902        if image_.type != None: self.imageType.setText(str(image_.type))       
 903        else: self.colorSpace.setText(" ........ ")
 904        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Bits Per Sample'] != None: self.imageBPS.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Bits Per Sample']))
 905        else: self.imageBPS.setText(" ........ ")
 906        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Exposure Time'] != None: self.imageExpoTime.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Exposure Time'][0])+" / " + str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Exposure Time'][1]))
 907        else: self.imageExpoTime.setText(" ........ ")
 908        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['F Number'] != None: self.imageFNumber.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['F Number'][0]))    
 909        else: self.imageFNumber.setText(" ........ ")
 910        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['ISO'] != None: self.imageISO.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['ISO']))       
 911        else: self.imageISO.setText(" ........ ")
 912        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Camera'] != None: self.imageCamera.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Camera'])      
 913        else: self.imageCamera.setText(" ........ ")
 914        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Software'] != None: self.imageSoftware.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Software'])      
 915        else: self.imageSoftware.setText(" ........ ")
 916        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Lens'] != None: self.imageLens.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Lens'])
 917        else: self.imageLens.setText(" ........ ")
 918        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Focal Length'] != None: self.imageFocalLength.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Focal Length'][0]))
 919        else: self.imageFocalLength.setText(" ........ ")
 920        # ---------------------------------------------------
 921        self.controller.callBackActive = False
 922        # ---------------------------------------------------
 923        tagRootName = image_.metadata.otherTags.getTagsRootName()
 924        listOfTags = image_.metadata.metadata[tagRootName]
 925
 926        for i,tagGroup in enumerate(listOfTags):
 927            groupKey = list(tagGroup.keys())[0]
 928            tagLeafs = tagGroup[groupKey]
 929            for tag in tagLeafs.items():
 930                # find advanced checkbox
 931                for acb in self.userDefinedTags:
 932                    if (acb.rightText ==tag[0] ) and (acb.leftText== groupKey):
 933                        on_off = image_.metadata.metadata[tagRootName][i][groupKey][tag[0]]
 934                        on_off = on_off if on_off else False
 935                        acb.setState(on_off)
 936                        break  
 937        # ---------------------------------------------------        
 938        self.controller.callBackActive = True
 939        # ---------------------------------------------------
 940        return self.imageWidgetController.setImage(image_)
 941
 942    def metadataChange(self,metaGroup,metaTag, on_off): 
 943        """
 944        Handle user changes to custom metadata tags.
 945        
 946        Args:
 947            metaGroup (str): Metadata group name
 948            metaTag (str): Specific tag name
 949            on_off (bool): New tag state
 950        """
 951        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.metadataChange(metaGroup,metaTag, on_off)
 952# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 953# --- class AdvanceLineEdit(object) --------------------------------------------------------
 954# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 955class AdvanceLineEdit(object):
 956    """
 957    Enhanced line edit widget with label for metadata display.
 958    
 959    Provides a labeled text input widget optimized for displaying and
 960    potentially editing metadata values in forms. Includes automatic
 961    layout management and optional change callbacks.
 962    
 963    Attributes:
 964        label (QLabel): Display label for the field
 965        lineEdit (QLineEdit): Text input widget
 966    
 967    Methods:
 968        setText: Update the displayed text value
 969    """
 970    def __init__(self, labelName, defaultText, layout, callBack=None):
 971        """
 972        Initialize labeled line edit widget.
 973        
 974        Args:
 975            labelName (str): Display label text
 976            defaultText (str): Initial/default text value
 977            layout (QFormLayout): Parent layout to add widget to
 978            callBack (function, optional): Text change callback function
 979        """
 980        self.label = QLabel(labelName)
 981        self.lineEdit =QLineEdit(defaultText)
 982        if callBack: self.lineEdit.textChanged.connect(callBack)
 983        layout.addRow(self.label,self.lineEdit)
 984
 985    def setText(self, txt): 
 986        """
 987        Update the displayed text value.
 988        
 989        Args:
 990            txt (str): New text to display
 991        """
 992        self.lineEdit.setText(txt)
 993# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 994# --- class AdvanceCheckBox(object) --------------------------------------------------------
 995# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 996class AdvanceCheckBox(object):
 997    """
 998    Enhanced checkbox widget with label for metadata editing.
 999    
1000    Provides a labeled checkbox widget optimized for editing user-defined
1001    metadata tags. Supports callback functionality for metadata updates
1002    and automatic layout management.
1003    
1004    Attributes:
1005        parent (ImageInfoView): Parent view for callback delegation
1006        leftText (str): Left label text (group name)
1007        rightText (str): Right label text (tag name)
1008        label (QLabel): Display label widget
1009        checkbox (QCheckBox): Checkbox control
1010    
1011    Methods:
1012        setState: Set checkbox checked state
1013        toggled: Handle checkbox state changes
1014    """
1015    def __init__(self, parent, leftText, rightText, defaultValue, layout):
1016        """
1017        Initialize labeled checkbox widget.
1018        
1019        Args:
1020            parent (ImageInfoView): Parent view for callbacks
1021            leftText (str): Left label text (metadata group)
1022            rightText (str): Right label text (metadata tag)
1023            defaultValue (bool): Initial checkbox state
1024            layout (QFormLayout): Parent layout to add widget to
1025        """
1026        self.parent = parent
1027
1028        self.leftText = leftText
1029        self.rightText = rightText
1030
1031        self.label = QLabel(leftText)
1032        self.checkbox =QCheckBox(rightText)
1033        self.checkbox.toggled.connect(self.toggled)
1034        layout.addRow(self.label,self.checkbox)
1035
1036    def setState(self, on_off): 
1037        """
1038        Set checkbox checked state.
1039        
1040        Args:
1041            on_off (bool): New checked state
1042        """
1043        self.checkbox.setChecked(on_off)
1044
1045    def toggled(self): 
1046        """
1047        Handle checkbox state changes and notify parent.
1048        """
1049        self.parent.metadataChange(self.leftText, self.rightText, self.checkbox.isChecked())

1051# --- class EditImageView(QSplitter) -------------------------------------------------------
1052# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1053class EditImageView(QSplitter):
1054    """
1055    Comprehensive HDR image editing interface with all editing controls.
1056    
1057    Provides the complete HDR editing interface with real-time preview and
1058    extensive parameter controls. Includes exposure, contrast, tone curves,
1059    color editing, geometry transformations, and HDR preview capabilities.
1060    
1061    Layout Structure:
1062    - Top: Image preview showing real-time edits
1063    - Bottom: Scrollable controls panel with:
1064      * Basic adjustments (exposure, contrast, saturation)
1065      * Advanced tone curve with B-spline control points
1066      * Lightness masking for selective editing
1067      * Five independent color editors in LCH space
1068      * Automatic color selection tools
1069      * Geometry transformations (rotation, cropping)
1070      * HDR preview controls
1071    
1072    Attributes:
1073        controller (EditImageController): Parent controller reference
1074        imageWidgetController (ImageWidgetController): Image preview controller
1075        exposure, contrast, saturation (AdvanceSliderController): Basic adjustment controls
1076        tonecurve (ToneCurveController): B-spline tone curve editor
1077        lightnessmask (LightnessMaskController): Tone range masking
1078        colorEditor0-4 (LchColorSelectorController): Independent color editors
1079        colorEditorsAuto (ColorEditorsAutoController): Automatic color selection
1080        geometry (GeometryController): Rotation and cropping controls
1081        hdrPreview (HDRviewerView): HDR display preview interface
1082        scroll (QScrollArea): Scrollable container for all controls
1083    
1084    Methods:
1085        setImage: Update image preview display
1086        autoExposure: Trigger automatic exposure calculation
1087        changeExposure: Handle manual exposure adjustments
1088        autoContrast: Trigger automatic contrast calculation
1089        changeContrast: Handle manual contrast adjustments
1090        autoSaturation: Trigger automatic saturation calculation
1091        changeSaturation: Handle manual saturation adjustments
1092        plotToneCurve: Update tone curve visualization
1093        setProcessPipe: Initialize interface with ProcessPipe parameters
1094    """
1095
1096    def __init__(self, _controller, build=False):
1097        """
1098        Initialize comprehensive HDR editing interface.
1099        
1100        Creates all editing controls and sets up the scrollable interface
1101        with proper callback connections for real-time parameter updates.
1102        
1103        Args:
1104            _controller (EditImageController): Parent controller instance
1105            build (bool): Whether to restore previous state during construction
1106        """
1107        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> EditImageView.__init__(",")")
1108        super().__init__(Qt.Vertical)
1109
1110        self.controller = _controller
1111
1112        self.imageWidgetController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
1113
1114        self.layout = QVBoxLayout()
1115
1116        # exposure ----------------------
1117        self.exposure = controller.AdvanceSliderController(self, "exposure",0,(-10,+10),0.25)
1118        # call back functions
1119        self.exposure.callBackAutoPush = self.autoExposure
1120        self.exposure.callBackValueChange = self.changeExposure
1121        self.layout.addWidget(self.exposure.view)
1122
1123        # contrast ----------------------
1124        self.contrast = controller.AdvanceSliderController(self, "contrast",0,(-100,+100),1)
1125        # call back functions
1126        self.contrast.callBackAutoPush = self.autoContrast
1127        self.contrast.callBackValueChange = self.changeContrast
1128        self.layout.addWidget(self.contrast.view)
1129
1130        # tonecurve ----------------------
1131        self.tonecurve = controller.ToneCurveController(self)        
1132        self.layout.addWidget(self.tonecurve.view)                   
1133
1134        # mask ----------------------
1135        self.lightnessmask = controller.LightnessMaskController(self)        
1136        self.layout.addWidget(self.lightnessmask.view)                   
1137 
1138        # saturation ----------------------
1139        self.saturation = controller.AdvanceSliderController(self, "saturation",0,(-100,+100),1)
1140        # call back functions
1141        self.saturation.callBackAutoPush = self.autoSaturation
1142        self.saturation.callBackValueChange = self.changeSaturation
1143        self.layout.addWidget(self.saturation.view)
1144
1145        # color0 ----------------------
1146        self.colorEditor0 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor0")
1147        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor0.view)
1148
1149        # color1 ----------------------
1150        self.colorEditor1 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor1")
1151        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor1.view)
1152
1153        # color2 ----------------------
1154        self.colorEditor2 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor2")
1155        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor2.view)
1156
1157        # color3 ----------------------
1158        self.colorEditor3 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor3")
1159        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor3.view)
1160
1161        # color1 ----------------------
1162        self.colorEditor4 = controller.LchColorSelectorController(self, idName = "colorEditor4")
1163        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditor4.view)
1164
1165        # auto color selection ----------------------
1166        # -----
1167        self.colorEditorsAuto = controller.ColorEditorsAutoController(self,
1168                                                                      [self.colorEditor0,
1169                                                                       self.colorEditor1,
1170                                                                       self.colorEditor2,
1171                                                                       self.colorEditor3,
1172                                                                       self.colorEditor4],
1173                                                                       "saturation")
1174        self.layout.addWidget(self.colorEditorsAuto.view)
1175        # -----
1176
1177        # geometry ----------------------
1178        self.geometry = controller.GeometryController(self)
1179        self.layout.addWidget(self.geometry.view)
1180
1181        # hdr preview ----------------------
1182        self.hdrPreview = HDRviewerView(self.controller.controllerHDR, build)
1183        self.controller.controllerHDR.setView(self.hdrPreview)
1184        self.layout.addWidget(self.hdrPreview)
1185
1186        # scroll ------------------------------------------------
1187        self.layout.setSizeConstraint(QLayout.SetMinAndMaxSize)
1188
1189        self.scroll = QScrollArea()
1190        self.scroll.setVerticalScrollBarPolicy(Qt.ScrollBarAlwaysOn)
1191        self.container = QLabel()
1192        self.container.setLayout(self.layout)
1193        self.scroll.setWidget(self.container)
1194        self.scroll.setWidgetResizable(True)
1195
1196        # adding widgets to self (QSplitter)
1197        self.addWidget(self.imageWidgetController.view)
1198        self.addWidget(self.scroll)
1199        self.setSizes([60,40])

1284    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):
1285        """
1286        Initialize interface with ProcessPipe parameters.
1287        
1288        Recovers all editing parameters from the ProcessPipe and restores
1289        the interface state to match the current image's editing configuration.
1290        This method is called when switching between images to maintain
1291        consistent editing state.
1292        
1293        Args:
1294            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline with current parameters
1295        """
1296        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> EditImageView.setProcessPipe(",")")
1297
1298        # exposure
1299        # recover value in pipe and restore it
1300        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("exposure")
1301        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1302        self.exposure.setValue(value['EV'], callBackActive = False)
1303
1304        # contrast
1305        # recover value in pipe and restore it
1306        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("contrast")
1307        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1308        self.contrast.setValue(value['contrast'], callBackActive = False)
1309
1310        # tonecurve
1311        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1312        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
1313        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1314        self.tonecurve.setValues(value,callBackActive = False)
1315
1316        # lightnessmask
1317        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1318        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("lightnessmask")
1319        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1320        self.lightnessmask.setValues(value,callBackActive = False)
1321
1322        # saturation
1323        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1324        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("saturation")
1325        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1326        self.saturation.setValue(value['saturation'], callBackActive = False)
1327
1328        # colorEditor0
1329        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1330        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor0")
1331        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1332        self.colorEditor0.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1333
1334        # colorEditor1
1335        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1336        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor1")
1337        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1338        self.colorEditor1.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1339
1340        # colorEditor2
1341        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1342        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor2")
1343        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1344        self.colorEditor2.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1345
1346        # colorEditor3
1347        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1348        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor3")
1349        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1350        self.colorEditor3.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1351        
1352        # colorEditor4
1353        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1354        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor4")
1355        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1356        self.colorEditor4.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1357        
1358        # geometry
1359        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1360        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("geometry")
1361        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1362        self.geometry.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)

1364# --- class MultiDockView(QDockWidget) -----------------------------------------------------
1365# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1366class MultiDockView(QDockWidget):
1367    def __init__(self, _controller, HDRcontroller=None):
1368        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.__init__(",")")
1369
1370        super().__init__("Image Edit/Info")
1371        self.controller = _controller
1372
1373        self.setAllowedAreas(Qt.LeftDockWidgetArea | Qt.RightDockWidgetArea)
1374      
1375        self.childControllers = [
1376            controller.EditImageController(self, HDRcontroller), 
1377            controller.ImageInfoController(self), 
1378            controller.ImageAestheticsController(self)]
1379            #controller.ImageQualityController(self, HDRcontroller)]
1380        self.childController = self.childControllers[0]
1381        self.active = 0
1382        self.setWidget(self.childController.view)
1383        self.repaint()
1384    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1385    def switch(self,nb):
1386        """
1387            change active dock
1388            nb = 0 > editing imag dock
1389            nb = 1 > image info and metadata dock
1390            nb = 2 > image aesthetics model 
1391        """
1392        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.switch(",nb,")")
1393
1394        if nb != self.active:
1395     
1396            self.active = (nb)%len(self.childControllers)
1397            self.childController.view.deleteLater()
1398            self.childController = self.childControllers[self.active]
1399            # rebuild view 
1400            processPipe = self.controller.parent.imageGalleryController.getSelectedProcessPipe()
1401            self.childController.buildView(processPipe)
1402            self.setWidget(self.childController.view)
1403            self.repaint()
1404    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1405    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):
1406        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.setProcessPipe(",processPipe.getImage().name,")")
1407        return self.childController.setProcessPipe(processPipe)

1413class AdvanceSliderView(QFrame):
1414    def __init__(self, controller, name,defaultValue, range, step):
1415        super().__init__()
1416        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
1417        self.controller = controller
1418        self.firstrow = QFrame()
1419
1420        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
1421        self.hbox = QHBoxLayout()
1422        
1423        self.firstrow.setLayout(self.hbox)
1424
1425        self.label= QLabel(name)
1426        self.auto = QPushButton("auto")
1427        self.editValue = QLineEdit()
1428        self.editValue.setValidator(QDoubleValidator())
1429        self.editValue.setText(str(defaultValue))
1430        self.reset = QPushButton("reset")
1431
1432        self.hbox.addWidget(self.label)
1433        self.hbox.addWidget(self.auto)
1434        self.hbox.addWidget(self.editValue)
1435        self.hbox.addWidget(self.reset)
1436
1437        self.slider = QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
1438        self.slider.setRange(int(range[0]/step),int(range[1]/step))
1439        self.slider.setValue(int(defaultValue/step))
1440        self.slider.setSingleStep(1) 
1441
1442        self.vbox.addWidget(self.firstrow)
1443        self.vbox.addWidget(self.slider)
1444
1445        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
1446
1447        # callBackFunctions slider/reset/auto
1448        self.slider.valueChanged.connect(self.controller.sliderChange)
1449        self.reset.clicked.connect(self.controller.reset)
1450        self.auto.clicked.connect(self.controller.auto)

1739# --- class LchColorSelectorView(QFrame) ---------------------------------------------------
1740# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1741class LchColorSelectorView(QFrame):
1742    """
1743    LCH color space selection and editing interface.
1744    
1745    Provides comprehensive color editing in LCH (Lightness, Chroma, Hue) space
1746    with visual color bars, range selection sliders, and targeted editing controls.
1747    Allows precise color selection and adjustment with real-time visual feedback.
1748    
1749    Color Selection Components:
1750    - Hue bar: Visual hue spectrum (0-360)
1751    - Chroma bar: Saturation/colorfulness visualization (0-100)
1752    - Lightness bar: Brightness visualization (0-100)
1753    - Range sliders: Min/max selection for each component
1754    
1755    Color Editing Components:
1756    - Hue shift: Rotate colors around hue wheel (-180 to +180)
1757    - Exposure: Brightness adjustment (-3 to +3 stops)
1758    - Contrast: Local contrast enhancement (-100 to +100)
1759    - Saturation: Colorfulness adjustment (-100 to +100)
1760    
1761    Additional Features:
1762    - Selection mask preview
1763    - Reset buttons for selection and editing parameters
1764    - Real-time color bar updates based on selection
1765    
1766    Layout Structure:
1767    +------------------------------------------+
1768    | Hue Chroma Lightness color selector      |
1769    +------------------------------------------+
1770    | [Hue Color Bar Visualization]           |
1771    | [Min Hue Slider] [Max Hue Slider]       |
1772    | [Selected Hue Range Bar]                |
1773    +------------------------------------------+
1774    | [Chroma Color Bar Visualization]        |
1775    | [Min Chroma Slider] [Max Chroma Slider] |
1776    +------------------------------------------+
1777    | [Lightness Color Bar Visualization]     |
1778    | [Min Light Slider] [Max Light Slider]   |
1779    +------------------------------------------+
1780    | [Reset Selection]                        |
1781    +------------------------------------------+
1782    | color editor: hue shift, exposure, contrast, saturation |
1783    | hue shift:  [slider] [value]            |
1784    | saturation: [slider] [value]            |
1785    | exposure:   [slider] [value]            |
1786    | contrast:   [slider] [value]            |
1787    | [x] show selection                       |
1788    | [Reset Edit]                             |
1789    +------------------------------------------+
1790    
1791    Attributes:
1792        controller (LchColorSelectorController): Parent controller reference
1793        imageHueController, imageSaturationController, imageLightnessController: Color bar displays
1794        imageHueRangeController: Selected hue range visualization
1795        sliderHueMin, sliderHueMax: Hue range selection sliders
1796        sliderChromaMin, sliderChromaMax: Chroma range selection sliders
1797        sliderLightMin, sliderLightMax: Lightness range selection sliders
1798        sliderHueShift, sliderExposure, sliderContrast, sliderSaturation: Editing controls
1799        valueHueShift, valueExposure, valueContrast, valueSaturation: Value displays
1800        checkboxMask: Selection mask preview toggle
1801        resetSelection, resetEdit: Reset buttons
1802    
1803    Methods:
1804        sliderHueChange: Handle hue range selection changes
1805        sliderChromaChange: Handle chroma range selection changes
1806        sliderLightnessChange: Handle lightness range selection changes
1807        sliderHueShiftChange: Handle hue shift editing changes
1808        sliderExposureChange: Handle exposure editing changes
1809        sliderSaturationChange: Handle saturation editing changes
1810        sliderContrastChange: Handle contrast editing changes
1811        checkboxMaskChange: Handle mask preview toggle
1812    """
1813    def __init__(self, _controller, defaultValues=None):
1814        """
1815        Initialize LCH color selector interface.
1816        
1817        Args:
1818            _controller (LchColorSelectorController): Parent controller instance
1819            defaultValues: Optional default parameter values
1820        """
1821        super().__init__()
1822        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
1823        self.controller = _controller
1824
1825        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
1826
1827        self.labelSelector = QLabel("Hue Chroma Lighness color selector")
1828        # procedural image: Hue bar
1829        hueBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (0,360), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
1830        hueBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
1831        self.imageHueController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
1832        self.imageHueController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)
1833        self.imageHueController.setImage(hueBarRGB)
1834        hueBar2Lch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (0,360), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
1835        hueBar2RGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueBar2Lch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
1836        self.imageHueRangeController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
1837        self.imageHueRangeController.view.setMinimumSize(2, 72)

1841        self.sliderHueMin.setRange(0,360)

1846        self.sliderHueMax.setRange(0,360)

2002    # callbacks
2003    def sliderHueChange(self):
2004        """
2005        Handle hue range selection changes and update visual feedback.
2006        
2007        Updates hue range visualization and chroma bar based on selected
2008        hue range, then notifies controller of the change.
2009        """
2010        hmin = self.sliderHueMin.value()
2011        hmax = self.sliderHueMax.value()
2012
2013        # redraw hue range and chroma bar
2014        hueRangeBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (hmin,hmax), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
2015        hueRangeBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueRangeBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2016        self.imageHueRangeController.setImage(hueRangeBarRGB)
2017        saturationBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (0,100), (hmin,hmax), (20,720), width='c', height='L')
2018        saturationBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(saturationBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2019        self.imageSaturationController.setImage(saturationBarRGB)
2020
2021        # call controller
2022        self.controller.sliderHueChange(hmin,hmax)
2023
2024    def sliderChromaChange(self):
2025        """Handle chroma range selection changes."""
2026        vmin = self.sliderChromaMin.value()
2027        vmax = self.sliderChromaMax.value()
2028        # call controller
2029        self.controller.sliderChromaChange(vmin,vmax)
2030
2031    def sliderLightnessChange(self):
2032        """Handle lightness range selection changes."""
2033        vmin = self.sliderLightMin.value()/3.0
2034        vmax = self.sliderLightMax.value()/3.0
2035        # call controller
2036        self.controller.sliderLightnessChange(vmin,vmax)
2037
2038    def sliderExposureChange(self):
2039        """Handle exposure editing changes with 0.1 stop precision."""
2040        ev = round(self.sliderExposure.value()/30,1)
2041        # force to 0.1 precision
2042        self.valueExposure.setText(str(ev))
2043        self.controller.sliderExposureChange(ev)
2044
2045    def sliderSaturationChange(self):
2046        """Handle saturation editing changes."""
2047        ev = self.sliderSaturation.value()
2048        self.valueSaturation.setText(str(ev))
2049        self.controller.sliderSaturationChange(ev)
2050
2051    def sliderContrastChange(self):
2052        """Handle contrast editing changes."""
2053        ev = self.sliderContrast.value()
2054        self.valueContrast.setText(str(ev))
2055        self.controller.sliderContrastChange(ev)
2056
2057    def sliderHueShiftChange(self):
2058        """Handle hue shift editing changes."""
2059        hs = self.sliderHueShift.value()
2060        self.valueHueShift.setText(str(hs))
2061        self.controller.sliderHueShiftChange(hs)
2062
2063    def checkboxMaskChange(self):
2064        """Handle selection mask preview toggle."""
2065        self.controller.checkboxMaskChange(self.checkboxMask.isChecked())

2069class GeometryView(QFrame):
2070    """
2071    Geometric transformation controls for rotation and cropping adjustments.
2072    
2073    Provides sliders for basic geometric corrections including:
2074    - Vertical cropping adjustment: Fine-tune vertical positioning for aspect ratio cropping
2075    - Rotation: Small angle corrections for straightening images
2076    
2077    Layout:
2078    +------------------------------------------+
2079    | cropping adj. [slider] [value]          |
2080    | rotation      [slider] [value]          |
2081    +------------------------------------------+
2082    
2083    Attributes:
2084        controller (GeometryController): Parent controller reference
2085        sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement: Vertical cropping offset slider
2086        valueCroppingVerticalAdjustement: Cropping adjustment value display
2087        sliderRotation: Rotation angle slider
2088        valueRotation: Rotation value display
2089    
2090    Methods:
2091        sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustementChange: Handle cropping adjustment changes
2092        sliderRotationChange: Handle rotation changes
2093    """
2094    def __init__(self, _controller):
2095        """
2096        Initialize geometry transformation interface.
2097        
2098        Args:
2099            _controller (GeometryController): Parent controller instance
2100        """
2101        super().__init__()
2102        self.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
2103        self.controller = _controller
2104
2105        self.vbox = QVBoxLayout()
2106
2107        # cropping adjustement 
2108        self.frameCroppingVerticalAdjustement = QFrame()
2109        self.layoutCroppingVerticalAdjustement = QHBoxLayout()
2110        self.frameCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setLayout(self.layoutCroppingVerticalAdjustement)
2111        self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2112        self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setRange(-100,+100)
2113        self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setValue(0)
2114        self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setSingleStep(1) 
2115        self.valueCroppingVerticalAdjustement = QLineEdit()
2116        self.valueCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setText(str(0.0))  
2117        self.layoutCroppingVerticalAdjustement.addWidget(QLabel("cropping adj."))
2118        self.layoutCroppingVerticalAdjustement.addWidget(self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement)
2119        self.layoutCroppingVerticalAdjustement.addWidget(self.valueCroppingVerticalAdjustement)
2120
2121        # rotation 
2122        self.frameRotation = QFrame()
2123        self.layoutRotation = QHBoxLayout()
2124        self.frameRotation.setLayout(self.layoutRotation)
2125        self.sliderRotation =   QSlider(Qt.Horizontal)
2126        self.sliderRotation.setRange(-60,+60)
2127        self.sliderRotation.setValue(0)
2128        self.sliderRotation.setSingleStep(1) 
2129        self.valueRotation = QLineEdit()
2130        self.valueRotation.setText(str(0.0))  
2131        self.layoutRotation.addWidget(QLabel("rotation"))
2132        self.layoutRotation.addWidget(self.sliderRotation)
2133        self.layoutRotation.addWidget(self.valueRotation)
2134
2135        self.vbox.addWidget(self.frameCroppingVerticalAdjustement)
2136        self.vbox.addWidget(self.frameRotation)
2137
2138        self.setLayout(self.vbox)
2139
2140        self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustementChange)
2141        self.sliderRotation.valueChanged.connect(self.sliderRotationChange)
2142
2143    # callbacks
2144    def sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustementChange(self):
2145        """Handle vertical cropping adjustment changes."""
2146        v = self.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustement.value()
2147        self.valueCroppingVerticalAdjustement.setText(str(v))
2148        # call controller
2149        self.controller.sliderCroppingVerticalAdjustementChange(v)

2151    def sliderRotationChange(self):
2152        """Handle rotation angle changes with 1/6 degree precision."""
2153        v = self.sliderRotation.value()/6
2154        self.valueRotation.setText(str(v))
2155        # call controller
2156        self.controller.sliderRotationChange(v)

2158# --- class ImageAestheticsView(QSplitter) -------------------------------------------------
2159# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2160class ImageAestheticsView(QSplitter):
2161    """
2162    Image aesthetics analysis and color palette visualization interface.
2163    
2164    Provides tools for analyzing image aesthetics including dominant color
2165    extraction, color palette generation, and visual composition analysis.
2166    Uses K-means clustering for color palette extraction with configurable
2167    parameters.
2168    
2169    Layout Structure:
2170    - Top: Image preview showing current processing result
2171    - Bottom: Scrollable controls panel with:
2172      * Process output selector (which processing step to analyze)
2173      * Number of colors configuration (2-8 colors)
2174      * Generated color palette visualization
2175    
2176    Analysis Features:
2177    - Dominant color extraction using K-means clustering
2178    - Configurable color count (2-8 dominant colors)
2179    - Process step selection for analysis input
2180    - Visual color palette representation
2181    - Extensible for composition and strength line analysis
2182    
2183    Layout:

class ImageWidgetView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QWidget): 
 94class ImageWidgetView(QWidget):
 95    """
 96    Basic image display widget for showing numpy arrays or HDR images.
 97    
 98    Provides a simple image viewer widget that can display color data
 99    as QPixmap with automatic scaling and aspect ratio preservation.
100    Handles clipping and conversion from floating-point HDR data to
101    8-bit RGB for Qt display.
102    
103    Attributes:
104        controller: Reference to controlling ImageWidgetController
105        label (QLabel): Qt label widget for pixmap display
106        imagePixmap (QPixmap): Current pixmap for display
107    
108    Methods:
109        resize: Update widget and pixmap scaling
110        resizeEvent: Handle Qt resize events
111        setPixmap: Set image from numpy array with preprocessing
112        setQPixmap: Set pre-processed QPixmap directly
113        emptyImageColorData: Generate default placeholder image [Static]
114    """
115
116    def __init__(self,controller,colorData = None):
117        """
118        Initialize image widget view.
119        
120        Args:
121            controller: Parent ImageWidgetController instance
122            colorData (numpy.ndarray, optional): Initial image data to display
123        """
124        super().__init__()
125        self.controller = controller
126        self.label = QLabel(self)   # create a QtLabel for pixmap
127        if not isinstance(colorData, np.ndarray): colorData = ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData()
128        # self.colorData = colorData  # image content attributes           
129        self.setPixmap(colorData)  
130
131    def resize(self):
132        """
133        Update widget and pixmap scaling to current size.
134        
135        Resizes the internal label and scales the pixmap to fit the widget
136        while preserving aspect ratio.
137        """
138        self.label.resize(self.size())
139        self.label.setPixmap(self.imagePixmap.scaled(self.size(),Qt.KeepAspectRatio))
140
141    def resizeEvent(self,event):
142        """
143        Handle Qt resize events.
144        
145        Args:
146            event: Qt resize event object
147        """
148        self.resize()
149        super().resizeEvent(event)
150
151    def setPixmap(self,colorData):
152        """
153        Set image from numpy array with HDR to sRGB conversion.
154        
155        Converts floating-point HDR image data to 8-bit RGB for Qt display.
156        Applies clipping to [0,1] range and handles format conversion.
157        
158        Args:
159            colorData (numpy.ndarray): RGB image data (height, width, 3)
160            
161        Returns:
162            QPixmap: Generated pixmap for display
163        """
164        if not isinstance(colorData, np.ndarray): 
165            colorData = ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData()
166        # self.colorData = colorData
167        height, width, channel = colorData.shape   # compute pixmap
168        bytesPerLine = channel * width
169        # clip
170        colorData[colorData>1.0] = 1.0
171        colorData[colorData<0.0] = 0.0
172
173        qImg = QImage((colorData*255).astype(np.uint8), width, height, bytesPerLine, QImage.Format_RGB888) # QImage
174        self.imagePixmap = QPixmap.fromImage(qImg)
175        self.resize()
176
177        return self.imagePixmap
178
179    def setQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
180        """
181        Set pre-processed QPixmap directly.
182        
183        Args:
184            qPixmap (QPixmap): Pre-processed pixmap for display
185        """
186        self.imagePixmap = qPixmap
187        self.resize()
188
189    def emptyImageColorData(): 
190        """
191        Generate default placeholder image for empty display.
192        
193        Returns:
194            numpy.ndarray: Gray placeholder image (90x160x3) 
195        """
196        return np.ones((90,160,3))*(220/255)
