class FigureWidget(matplotlib.backends.backend_qtagg.FigureCanvasQTAgg): 
200class FigureWidget(FigureCanvas):
201    """
202    Matplotlib figure widget for embedding plots in Qt interface.
203    
204    Provides matplotlib integration for displaying curves, histograms,
205    and other plots within the Qt GUI. Used primarily for tone curve
206    visualization and editing.
207    
208    Attributes:
209        fig (Figure): Matplotlib figure object
210        axes: Matplotlib axes for plotting
211    
212    Methods:
213        plot: Draw line plot with specified data and style
214    """
215
216    def __init__(self, parent=None, width=5, height=5, dpi=100):
217        """
218        Initialize matplotlib figure widget.
219        
220        Args:
221            parent: Parent Qt widget
222            width (int): Figure width in inches
223            height (int): Figure height in inches
224            dpi (int): Figure resolution in dots per inch
225        """
226        # create Figure
227        self.fig = Figure(figsize=(width, height), dpi=dpi)
228        self.axes = self.fig.add_subplot(111)
229        FigureCanvas.__init__(self, self.fig)    # explicite call of super constructor
230        self.setParent(parent)
231        FigureCanvas.updateGeometry(self)
232        self.setMinimumSize(200, 200)
233
234    def plot(self,X,Y,mode, clear=False):
235        """
236        Draw line plot with specified data and style.
237        
238        Args:
239            X (array-like): X-coordinate data points
240            Y (array-like): Y-coordinate data points
241            mode (str): Matplotlib line style (e.g., 'r--', 'b-')
242            clear (bool): Clear previous plots before drawing
243        """
244        if clear: self.axes.clear()
245        self.axes.plot(X,Y,mode)
246        try:
247            self.fig.canvas.draw()
248        except Exception:
249            time.sleep(0.5)
250            self.fig.canvas.draw()

class ImageGalleryView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QSplitter): 
255class ImageGalleryView(QSplitter):
256    """
257    Grid-based image gallery with pagination and navigation controls.
258    
259    Displays multiple images in a configurable grid layout with pagination
260    support for large image collections. Provides interactive navigation
261    buttons and supports different grid configurations (1x1, 3x2, 6x4, 9x6).
262    
263    Layout Structure:
264        +-------------------------------------------+
265        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | \
266        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
267        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
268        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
269        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
270        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
271        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |   >   GridLayout
272        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
273        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
274        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ |  |
275        | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |  |
276        | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | /
277        +-------------------------------------------+  <    splitter
278        | [<] [1x1][3x2][6x4][9x6][page number] [>] |       [pushButton] HorizontalLayout
279        +-------------------------------------------+
280    
281    Attributes:
282        controller: Reference to ImageGalleryController
283        shapeMode: Current grid layout mode (GalleryMode enum)
284        pageNumber (int): Current page index (0-based)
285        imagesControllers (list): List of ImageWidgetController instances
286        images (QFrame): Frame containing image grid
287        imagesLayout (QGridLayout): Grid layout for images
288        buttons (QWidget): Navigation button container
289        pageNumberLabel (QLabel): Current page display
290    
291    Methods:
292        currentPage: Get current page number
293        changePageNumber: Navigate to different page
294        updateImages: Refresh image display for current page
295        updateImage: Update specific image in grid
296        resetGridLayoutWidgets: Clear current grid widgets
297        buildGridLayoutWidgets: Create new grid layout
298        wheelEvent: Handle mouse wheel navigation
299        mousePressEvent: Handle image selection clicks
300    """
301    def __init__(self,controller_=None,shapeMode=None):
302        """
303        Initialize image gallery view.
304        
305        Args:
306            controller_: Parent ImageGalleryController instance
307            shapeMode: Initial grid layout mode (defaults to 3x2)
308        """
309        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.__init__(",")")
310
311        super().__init__(Qt.Vertical)
312
313        self.controller= controller_
314        self.shapeMode = controller.GalleryMode._3x2 if not shapeMode else shapeMode    # default display mode 
315        self.pageNumber =0
316
317        self.imagesControllers = []
318
319        self.images = QFrame()
320        self.images.setFrameShape(QFrame.StyledPanel)
321        self.imagesLayout = QGridLayout()
322        self.images.setLayout(self.imagesLayout)
323
324        self.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
325
326        self.previousPageButton =   QPushButton('<')
327        self.previousPageButton.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_previousPage)
328        self._1x1Button =           QPushButton('1x1')
329        self._1x1Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_1x1)
330        self._2x1Button =           QPushButton('2x1')
331        self._2x1Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_2x1)
332        self._3x2Button =           QPushButton('3x2')
333        self._3x2Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_3x2)
334        self._6x4Button =           QPushButton('6x4')
335        self._6x4Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_6x4)
336        self._9x6Button =           QPushButton('9x6')
337        self._9x6Button.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_9x6)
338        self.nextPageButton =       QPushButton('>')
339        self.nextPageButton.clicked.connect(self.controller.callBackButton_nextPage)
340
341        self.pageNumberLabel = QLabel(str(self.pageNumber)+"/ ...")
342
343        self.buttons = QWidget()
344        self.buttonsLayout = QHBoxLayout()
345        self.buttons.setLayout(self.buttonsLayout)
346        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self.previousPageButton)
347        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._1x1Button)
348        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._2x1Button)
349        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._3x2Button)
350        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._6x4Button)
351        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self._9x6Button)
352        self.buttonsLayout.addWidget(self.nextPageButton)
353

357        self.addWidget(self.buttons)
358        self.setSizes([1525,82])
359
360    def currentPage(self): 
361        """
362        Get current page number.
363        
364        Returns:
365            int: Current page index (0-based)
366        """
367        return self.pageNumber
368
369    def changePageNumber(self,step):
370        """
371        Navigate to different page with wraparound.
372        
373        Changes the current page by the specified step, with automatic
374        wraparound at the beginning and end of the page range.
375        
376        Args:
377            step (int): Page increment/decrement (+1 for next, -1 for previous)
378        """
379        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.changePageNumber(",step,")")
380
381        nbImagePerPage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)
382        maxPage = ((len(self.controller.model.processPipes)-1)//nbImagePerPage) + 1
383
384        if len(self.controller.model.processPipes) > 0 :
385
386            oldPageNumber = self.pageNumber
387            if (self.pageNumber+step) > maxPage-1:
388                self.pageNumber = 0
389            elif (self.pageNumber+step) <0:
390                self.pageNumber = maxPage-1
391            else:
392                self.pageNumber  = self.pageNumber+step
393            self.updateImages()
394            self.controller.model.loadPage(self.pageNumber)
395            if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.changePageNumber(currentPage:",self.pageNumber," | max page:",maxPage,")")
396
397    def updateImages(self):
398        """
399        Refresh image display for current page.
400        
401        Updates all image widgets in the grid with placeholder content
402        and refreshes the page number display. Actual images are loaded
403        asynchronously by the model.
404        """
405        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.updateImages(",")")
406
407        """ update images content """
408        nbImagePerPage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)
409        maxPage = ((len(self.controller.model.processPipes)-1)//nbImagePerPage) + 1
410        
411        index=0
412        for i in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)): 
413            for j in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)):
414                # get image controllers                                                                                         
415                iwc = self.imagesControllers[index]
416                iwc.view.setPixmap(ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData())                                                 
417                index +=1                                                                                                                                                                                                           
418        self.pageNumberLabel.setText(str(self.pageNumber)+"/"+str(maxPage-1))
419
420    def updateImage(self, idx, processPipe, filename):
421        """
422        Update specific image in grid with loaded content.
423        
424        Args:
425            idx (int): Index of image within current page
426            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Loaded image processing pipeline
427            filename (str): Image filename for status display
428        """
429        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.updateImage(",")")
430        imageWidgetController = self.imagesControllers[idx]                                 
431        imageWidgetController.setImage(processPipe.getImage())
432        self.controller.parent.statusBar().showMessage("loading of image "+filename+" done!")
433
434    def resetGridLayoutWidgets(self):
435        """
436        Clear current grid layout widgets.
437        
438        Removes all image widgets from the grid layout and cleans up
439        memory by deleting widget references.
440        """
441        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.resetGridLayoutWidgets(",")")
442
443        for w in self.imagesControllers:
444            self.imagesLayout.removeWidget(w.view)
445            w.view.deleteLater()
446        self.imagesControllers = []
447
448    def buildGridLayoutWidgets(self):
449        """
450        Create new grid layout widgets based on current shape mode.
451        
452        Generates ImageWidgetController instances for each position in
453        the grid and adds them to the layout with proper positioning.
454        """
455        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.buildGridLayoutWidgets(",")")
456
457        imageIndex = 0
458        for i in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)): 
459            for j in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)):
460                iwc = controller.ImageWidgetController(id=imageIndex)
461                self.imagesControllers.append(iwc)
462                self.imagesLayout.addWidget(iwc.view,i,j)
463                imageIndex +=1
464
465    def wheelEvent(self, event):
466        """
467        Handle mouse wheel navigation between pages.
468        
469        Args:
470            event: Qt wheel event with scroll direction
471        """
472        if pref.verbose: print(" [EVENT] >> ImageGalleryView.wheelEvent(",")")
473
474        if event.angleDelta().y() < 0 :     
475            self.changePageNumber(+1)
476            if self.shapeMode == controller.GalleryMode._1x1 : 
477                self.controller.selectImage(0)
478
479        else :                              
480            self.changePageNumber(-1)
481            if self.shapeMode == controller.GalleryMode._1x1 : 
482                self.controller.selectImage(0)
483        event.accept()
484
485    def mousePressEvent(self,event):
486        """
487        Handle image selection clicks.
488        
489        Determines which image was clicked based on mouse position
490        and notifies the controller for selection handling.
491        
492        Args:
493            event: Qt mouse press event with position
494        """
495        if pref.verbose: print(" [EVENT] >> ImageGalleryView.mousePressEvent(",")")
496
497        # self.childAt(event.pos()) return QLabel .parent() should be ImageWidget object
498        if isinstance(self.childAt(event.pos()).parent(),ImageWidgetView):
499            id = self.childAt(event.pos()).parent().controller.id()
500        else:
501            id = -1
502
503        if id != -1: # an image is clicked select it!
504            self.controller.selectImage(id)
505        event.accept()

Grid-based image gallery with pagination and navigation controls.

Displays multiple images in a configurable grid layout with pagination support for large image collections. Provides interactive navigation buttons and supports different grid configurations (1x1, 3x2, 6x4, 9x6).

Layout Structure: +-------------------------------------------+ | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| | | | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | | | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | | | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| | | | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | | | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | > GridLayout | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| | | | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | | | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | | | |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| |ImgW| | | | +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ +----+ | / +-------------------------------------------+ < splitter | [<] [1x1][3x2][6x4][9x6][page number] [>] | [pushButton] HorizontalLayout +-------------------------------------------+

Attributes: controller: Reference to ImageGalleryController shapeMode: Current grid layout mode (GalleryMode enum) pageNumber (int): Current page index (0-based) imagesControllers (list): List of ImageWidgetController instances images (QFrame): Frame containing image grid imagesLayout (QGridLayout): Grid layout for images buttons (QWidget): Navigation button container pageNumberLabel (QLabel): Current page display

Methods: currentPage: Get current page number changePageNumber: Navigate to different page updateImages: Refresh image display for current page updateImage: Update specific image in grid resetGridLayoutWidgets: Clear current grid widgets buildGridLayoutWidgets: Create new grid layout wheelEvent: Handle mouse wheel navigation mousePressEvent: Handle image selection clicks

def changePageNumber(self, step): 
369    def changePageNumber(self,step):
370        """
371        Navigate to different page with wraparound.
372        
373        Changes the current page by the specified step, with automatic
374        wraparound at the beginning and end of the page range.
375        
376        Args:
377            step (int): Page increment/decrement (+1 for next, -1 for previous)
378        """
379        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.changePageNumber(",step,")")
380
381        nbImagePerPage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)
382        maxPage = ((len(self.controller.model.processPipes)-1)//nbImagePerPage) + 1
383
384        if len(self.controller.model.processPipes) > 0 :
385
386            oldPageNumber = self.pageNumber
387            if (self.pageNumber+step) > maxPage-1:
388                self.pageNumber = 0
389            elif (self.pageNumber+step) <0:
390                self.pageNumber = maxPage-1
391            else:
392                self.pageNumber  = self.pageNumber+step
393            self.updateImages()
394            self.controller.model.loadPage(self.pageNumber)
395            if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.changePageNumber(currentPage:",self.pageNumber," | max page:",maxPage,")")

Navigate to different page with wraparound.

Changes the current page by the specified step, with automatic wraparound at the beginning and end of the page range.

Args: step (int): Page increment/decrement (+1 for next, -1 for previous)

def updateImages(self): 
397    def updateImages(self):
398        """
399        Refresh image display for current page.
400        
401        Updates all image widgets in the grid with placeholder content
402        and refreshes the page number display. Actual images are loaded
403        asynchronously by the model.
404        """
405        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.updateImages(",")")
406
407        """ update images content """
408        nbImagePerPage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)
409        maxPage = ((len(self.controller.model.processPipes)-1)//nbImagePerPage) + 1
410        
411        index=0
412        for i in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.shapeMode)): 
413            for j in range(controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.shapeMode)):
414                # get image controllers                                                                                         
415                iwc = self.imagesControllers[index]
416                iwc.view.setPixmap(ImageWidgetView.emptyImageColorData())                                                 
417                index +=1                                                                                                                                                                                                           
418        self.pageNumberLabel.setText(str(self.pageNumber)+"/"+str(maxPage-1))

Refresh image display for current page.

Updates all image widgets in the grid with placeholder content and refreshes the page number display. Actual images are loaded asynchronously by the model.

def updateImage(self, idx, processPipe, filename): 
420    def updateImage(self, idx, processPipe, filename):
421        """
422        Update specific image in grid with loaded content.
423        
424        Args:
425            idx (int): Index of image within current page
426            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Loaded image processing pipeline
427            filename (str): Image filename for status display
428        """
429        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageGalleryView.updateImage(",")")
430        imageWidgetController = self.imagesControllers[idx]                                 
431        imageWidgetController.setImage(processPipe.getImage())
432        self.controller.parent.statusBar().showMessage("loading of image "+filename+" done!")

602    def setWindowGeometry(self, scale=0.8):
603        """
604        Configure window size and position based on available displays.
605        
606        Automatically detects multiple displays and positions window on
607        secondary display if available, otherwise uses primary display.
608        
609        Args:
610            scale (float): Window scaling factor (default 0.8)
611        """
612        displayCoord = QDesktopWidget().screenGeometry(1)
613        if len(self.controller.screenSize) > 1:
614            width, height = self.controller.screenSize[1].width(), self.controller.screenSize[1].height()
615        else:
616            width, height = self.controller.screenSize[0].width(), self.controller.screenSize[0].height()
617
618        self.setGeometry(displayCoord.left(), displayCoord.top()+50, math.floor(width*scale), math.floor(height*scale))
619        self.showMaximized()

Main application window for uHDR HDR image editing software.

Provides the primary user interface for uHDR with comprehensive menu system, dockable panels, and central image gallery. Manages window geometry, screen configuration, and application-wide functionality including file operations, HDR display management, and export capabilities.

Window Structure:

  • Central Widget: Image gallery with pagination
  • Right Dock: Multi-panel interface (Edit/Info/Aesthetics)
  • Menu Bar: File, Display HDR, Export, Dock, Preferences
  • Status Bar: Real-time operation feedback

def setWindowGeometry(self, scale=0.8): 
602    def setWindowGeometry(self, scale=0.8):
603        """
604        Configure window size and position based on available displays.
605        
606        Automatically detects multiple displays and positions window on
607        secondary display if available, otherwise uses primary display.
608        
609        Args:
610            scale (float): Window scaling factor (default 0.8)
611        """
612        displayCoord = QDesktopWidget().screenGeometry(1)
613        if len(self.controller.screenSize) > 1:
614            width, height = self.controller.screenSize[1].width(), self.controller.screenSize[1].height()
615        else:
616            width, height = self.controller.screenSize[0].width(), self.controller.screenSize[0].height()
617
618        self.setGeometry(displayCoord.left(), displayCoord.top()+50, math.floor(width*scale), math.floor(height*scale))
619        self.showMaximized()

Configure window size and position based on available displays.

Automatically detects multiple displays and positions window on secondary display if available, otherwise uses primary display.

Args: scale (float): Window scaling factor (default 0.8)

def buildFileMenu(self): 
621    def buildFileMenu(self):
622        """
623        Create file operations menu with directory selection, save, and quit.
624        
625        Menu Items:
626        - Select directory (Ctrl+O): Choose working directory
627        - Save (Ctrl+S): Save ProcessPipe metadata 
628        - Quit (Ctrl+Q): Exit application with cleanup
629        """
630        menubar = self.menuBar()# get menubar
631        fileMenu = menubar.addMenu('&File')# file menu
632
633        selectDir = QAction('&Select directory', self)        
634        selectDir.setShortcut('Ctrl+O')
635        selectDir.setStatusTip('[File] select a directory')
636        selectDir.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackSelectDir)
637        fileMenu.addAction(selectDir)
638
639        selectSave = QAction('&Save', self)        
640        selectSave.setShortcut('Ctrl+S')
641        selectSave.setStatusTip('[File] saving processpipe metadata')
642        selectSave.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackSave)
643        fileMenu.addAction(selectSave)
644
645        quit = QAction('&Quit', self)        
646        quit.setShortcut('Ctrl+Q')
647        quit.setStatusTip('[File] saving updates and quit')
648        quit.triggered.connect(self.controller.callBackQuit)
649        fileMenu.addAction(quit)

Create file operations menu with directory selection, save, and quit.

  • Quit (Ctrl+Q): Exit application with cleanup
def buildPreferences(self): 
651    def buildPreferences(self):
652        """
653        Create HDR display preferences menu with dynamic display selection.
654        
655        Automatically generates menu items for each configured HDR display
656        from preferences, allowing runtime switching between different HDR
657        monitor configurations.
658        """
659
660        menubar = self.menuBar()# get menubar
661        prefMenu = menubar.addMenu('&Preferences')# file menu
662
663        displayList = pref.getHDRdisplays().keys()
664
665        # function for callback
666        def cbd(tag): 
667            pref.setHDRdisplay(tag)
668            self.statusBar().showMessage("swithcing HDR Display to: "+tag+"!")
669            self.menuExport.setText('&Export to '+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag'])
670            self.menuExportAll.setText('&Export All to '+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag'])        
671
672        prefDisplays = []
673        for i,d in enumerate(displayList):
674            if d != 'none':
675                prefDisplay = QAction('&Set display to '+d, self) 
676                p_cbd = functools.partial(cbd, d)
677                prefDisplay.triggered.connect(p_cbd)
678                prefMenu.addAction(prefDisplay)

Create HDR display preferences menu with dynamic display selection.

Automatically generates menu items for each configured HDR display from preferences, allowing runtime switching between different HDR monitor configurations.

class ImageInfoView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QSplitter): 
781class ImageInfoView(QSplitter):
782    """
783    Image information and metadata display panel.
784    
785    Provides comprehensive display of image metadata including EXIF data,
786    technical parameters, and user-defined tags. Supports interactive editing
787    of custom metadata fields for workflow management and image classification.
788    
789    Layout Structure:
790    - Top: Image preview widget
791    - Bottom: Scrollable metadata form with:
792      * Technical metadata (name, path, size, dynamic range, etc.)
793      * EXIF data (exposure, ISO, camera, lens, etc.)
794      * User-defined workflow tags (organized by groups)
795    
796    Attributes:
797        controller (ImageInfoController): Parent controller reference
798        imageWidgetController (ImageWidgetController): Image preview controller
799        layout (QFormLayout): Metadata fields layout
800        imageName, imagePath, imageSize, etc.: Technical metadata widgets
801        userDefinedTags (list[AdvanceCheckBox]): Custom metadata checkboxes
802        scroll (QScrollArea): Scrollable container for metadata fields
803    
804    Methods:
805        setProcessPipe: Update display with new image and metadata
806        metadataChange: Handle user changes to custom metadata
807    """
808    def __init__(self, _controller):
809        """
810        Initialize image info view with metadata form.
811        
812        Args:
813            _controller (ImageInfoController): Parent controller instance
814        """
815        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageInfoView.__init__(",")")
816
817        super().__init__(Qt.Vertical)
818
819        self.controller = _controller
820
821        self.imageWidgetController = controller.ImageWidgetController()
822
823        self.layout = QFormLayout()
824
825        # ---------------------------------------------------
826        self.imageName =            AdvanceLineEdit(" name:", " ........ ",             self.layout, callBack=None)
827        self.imagePath =            AdvanceLineEdit(" path:", " ........ ",             self.layout, callBack=None)
828        self.imageSize =            AdvanceLineEdit(" size (pixel):", ".... x .... ",   self.layout, callBack=None)
829        self.imageDynamicRange =    AdvanceLineEdit(" dynamic range (f-stops)", " ........ ", self.layout, callBack=None)
830        self.colorSpace =           AdvanceLineEdit(" color space:", " ........ ",      self.layout, callBack=None)
831        self.imageType =            AdvanceLineEdit(" type:", " ........ ",             self.layout, callBack=None)                     
832        self.imageBPS =             AdvanceLineEdit(" bits per sample:", " ........ ",  self.layout, callBack=None)
833        self.imageExpoTime =        AdvanceLineEdit(" exposure time:", " ........ ",    self.layout, callBack=None)
834        self.imageFNumber =         AdvanceLineEdit("f-number:", " ........ ",          self.layout, callBack=None)          
835        self.imageISO =             AdvanceLineEdit(" ISO:", " ........ ",              self.layout, callBack=None)           
836        self.imageCamera =          AdvanceLineEdit(" camera:", " ........ ",           self.layout, callBack=None)      
837        self.imageSoftware =        AdvanceLineEdit(" software:", " ........ ",         self.layout, callBack=None)      
838        self.imageLens =            AdvanceLineEdit(" lens:", " ........ ",             self.layout, callBack=None)
839        self.imageFocalLength =     AdvanceLineEdit(" focal length:", " ........ ",     self.layout, callBack=None)
840        # ---------------------------------------------------
841        # ---------------------------------------------------
842        line = QFrame()
843        line.setFrameShape(QFrame.HLine)
844        self.layout.addRow(line)
845        # ---------------------------------------------------
846        #  user defined tags
847        # --------------------------------------------------
848        userDefinedTags = hdrCore.metadata.tags()
849        tagRootName = userDefinedTags.getTagsRootName()
850        listOfTags = userDefinedTags.tags[tagRootName]
851        self.userDefinedTags = []
852        for tagGroup in listOfTags:
853            groupKey = list(tagGroup.keys())[0]
854            tagLeafs = tagGroup[groupKey]
855            for tag in tagLeafs.items():
856                self.userDefinedTags.append( AdvanceCheckBox(self,groupKey, tag[0], False, self.layout))
857            line = QFrame()
858            line.setFrameShape(QFrame.HLine)
859            self.layout.addRow(line)
860        # --------------------------------------------------
861
862
863        self.layout.setSizeConstraint(QLayout.SetMinAndMaxSize)
864
865        self.scroll = QScrollArea()
866        self.scroll.setVerticalScrollBarPolicy(Qt.ScrollBarAlwaysOn)
867        self.container = QLabel()
868        self.container.setLayout(self.layout)
869        self.scroll.setWidget(self.container)
870        self.scroll.setWidgetResizable(True)
871
872        self.addWidget(self.imageWidgetController.view)
873        self.addWidget(self.scroll)
874        self.setSizes([60,40])
875
876    def setProcessPipe(self,processPipe): 
877        """
878        Update display with new image and populate all metadata fields.
879        
880        Extracts comprehensive metadata from the ProcessPipe's image including
881        EXIF data, technical parameters, and user-defined tags. Updates all
882        form fields and checkboxes to reflect current image state.
883        
884        Args:
885            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline containing image with metadata
886            
887        Returns:
888            Result of imageWidgetController.setImage() operation
889        """
890        image_ = processPipe.getImage()
891        # ---------------------------------------------------
892        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageInfoView.setImage(",image_.name,")")
893        if image_.metadata.metadata['filename'] != None: self.imageName.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['filename'])
894        else: self.imageName.setText(" ........ ")
895        if image_.metadata.metadata['path'] != None: self.imagePath.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['path'])
896        else: self.imagePath.setText(" ........ ")
897        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Image Width'] != None: self.imageSize.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Image Width'])+" x "+ str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Image Height']))
898        else: self.imageSize.setText(" ........ ")
899        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Dynamic Range (stops)'] != None: self.imageDynamicRange.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Dynamic Range (stops)']))
900        else: self.imageDynamicRange.setText(" ........ ")
901        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Color Space'] != None: self.colorSpace.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Color Space'])
902        else: self.imageName.setText(" ........ ")
903        if image_.type != None: self.imageType.setText(str(image_.type))       
904        else: self.colorSpace.setText(" ........ ")
905        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Bits Per Sample'] != None: self.imageBPS.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Bits Per Sample']))
906        else: self.imageBPS.setText(" ........ ")
907        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Exposure Time'] != None: self.imageExpoTime.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Exposure Time'][0])+" / " + str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Exposure Time'][1]))
908        else: self.imageExpoTime.setText(" ........ ")
909        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['F Number'] != None: self.imageFNumber.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['F Number'][0]))    
910        else: self.imageFNumber.setText(" ........ ")
911        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['ISO'] != None: self.imageISO.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['ISO']))       
912        else: self.imageISO.setText(" ........ ")
913        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Camera'] != None: self.imageCamera.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Camera'])      
914        else: self.imageCamera.setText(" ........ ")
915        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Software'] != None: self.imageSoftware.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Software'])      
916        else: self.imageSoftware.setText(" ........ ")
917        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Lens'] != None: self.imageLens.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Lens'])
918        else: self.imageLens.setText(" ........ ")
919        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Focal Length'] != None: self.imageFocalLength.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Focal Length'][0]))
920        else: self.imageFocalLength.setText(" ........ ")
921        # ---------------------------------------------------
922        self.controller.callBackActive = False
923        # ---------------------------------------------------
924        tagRootName = image_.metadata.otherTags.getTagsRootName()
925        listOfTags = image_.metadata.metadata[tagRootName]
926
927        for i,tagGroup in enumerate(listOfTags):
928            groupKey = list(tagGroup.keys())[0]
929            tagLeafs = tagGroup[groupKey]
930            for tag in tagLeafs.items():
931                # find advanced checkbox
932                for acb in self.userDefinedTags:
933                    if (acb.rightText ==tag[0] ) and (acb.leftText== groupKey):
934                        on_off = image_.metadata.metadata[tagRootName][i][groupKey][tag[0]]
935                        on_off = on_off if on_off else False
936                        acb.setState(on_off)
937                        break  
938        # ---------------------------------------------------        
939        self.controller.callBackActive = True
940        # ---------------------------------------------------
941        return self.imageWidgetController.setImage(image_)
942
943    def metadataChange(self,metaGroup,metaTag, on_off): 
944        """
945        Handle user changes to custom metadata tags.
946        
947        Args:
948            metaGroup (str): Metadata group name
949            metaTag (str): Specific tag name
950            on_off (bool): New tag state
951        """
952        if self.controller.callBackActive: self.controller.metadataChange(metaGroup,metaTag, on_off)

877        """
878        Update display with new image and populate all metadata fields.
879        
880        Extracts comprehensive metadata from the ProcessPipe's image including
881        EXIF data, technical parameters, and user-defined tags. Updates all
882        form fields and checkboxes to reflect current image state.
883        
884        Args:
885            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline containing image with metadata
886            
887        Returns:
888            Result of imageWidgetController.setImage() operation
889        """
890        image_ = processPipe.getImage()
891        # ---------------------------------------------------
892        if pref.verbose: print(" [VIEW] >> ImageInfoView.setImage(",image_.name,")")
893        if image_.metadata.metadata['filename'] != None: self.imageName.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['filename'])
894        else: self.imageName.setText(" ........ ")
895        if image_.metadata.metadata['path'] != None: self.imagePath.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['path'])
896        else: self.imagePath.setText(" ........ ")
897        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Image Width'] != None: self.imageSize.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Image Width'])+" x "+ str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Image Height']))
898        else: self.imageSize.setText(" ........ ")
899        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Dynamic Range (stops)'] != None: self.imageDynamicRange.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Dynamic Range (stops)']))
900        else: self.imageDynamicRange.setText(" ........ ")
901        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Color Space'] != None: self.colorSpace.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Color Space'])
902        else: self.imageName.setText(" ........ ")
903        if image_.type != None: self.imageType.setText(str(image_.type))       
904        else: self.colorSpace.setText(" ........ ")
905        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Bits Per Sample'] != None: self.imageBPS.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Bits Per Sample']))
906        else: self.imageBPS.setText(" ........ ")
907        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Exposure Time'] != None: self.imageExpoTime.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Exposure Time'][0])+" / " + str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Exposure Time'][1]))
908        else: self.imageExpoTime.setText(" ........ ")
909        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['F Number'] != None: self.imageFNumber.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['F Number'][0]))    
910        else: self.imageFNumber.setText(" ........ ")
911        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['ISO'] != None: self.imageISO.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['ISO']))       
912        else: self.imageISO.setText(" ........ ")
913        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Camera'] != None: self.imageCamera.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Camera'])      
914        else: self.imageCamera.setText(" ........ ")
915        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Software'] != None: self.imageSoftware.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Software'])      
916        else: self.imageSoftware.setText(" ........ ")
917        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Lens'] != None: self.imageLens.setText(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Lens'])
918        else: self.imageLens.setText(" ........ ")
919        if image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Focal Length'] != None: self.imageFocalLength.setText(str(image_.metadata.metadata['exif']['Focal Length'][0]))
920        else: self.imageFocalLength.setText(" ........ ")
921        # ---------------------------------------------------
922        self.controller.callBackActive = False
923        # ---------------------------------------------------
924        tagRootName = image_.metadata.otherTags.getTagsRootName()
925        listOfTags = image_.metadata.metadata[tagRootName]
926
927        for i,tagGroup in enumerate(listOfTags):
928            groupKey = list(tagGroup.keys())[0]
929            tagLeafs = tagGroup[groupKey]
930            for tag in tagLeafs.items():
931                # find advanced checkbox
932                for acb in self.userDefinedTags:
933                    if (acb.rightText ==tag[0] ) and (acb.leftText== groupKey):
934                        on_off = image_.metadata.metadata[tagRootName][i][groupKey][tag[0]]
935                        on_off = on_off if on_off else False
936                        acb.setState(on_off)
937                        break  
938        # ---------------------------------------------------        
939        self.controller.callBackActive = True
940        # ---------------------------------------------------
941        return self.imageWidgetController.setImage(image_)

1285    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):
1286        """
1287        Initialize interface with ProcessPipe parameters.
1288        
1289        Recovers all editing parameters from the ProcessPipe and restores
1290        the interface state to match the current image's editing configuration.
1291        This method is called when switching between images to maintain
1292        consistent editing state.
1293        
1294        Args:
1295            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline with current parameters
1296        """
1297        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> EditImageView.setProcessPipe(",")")
1298
1299        # exposure
1300        # recover value in pipe and restore it
1301        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("exposure")
1302        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1303        self.exposure.setValue(value['EV'], callBackActive = False)
1304
1305        # contrast
1306        # recover value in pipe and restore it
1307        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("contrast")
1308        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1309        self.contrast.setValue(value['contrast'], callBackActive = False)
1310
1311        # tonecurve
1312        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1313        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
1314        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1315        self.tonecurve.setValues(value,callBackActive = False)
1316
1317        # lightnessmask
1318        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1319        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("lightnessmask")
1320        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1321        self.lightnessmask.setValues(value,callBackActive = False)
1322
1323        # saturation
1324        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1325        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("saturation")
1326        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1327        self.saturation.setValue(value['saturation'], callBackActive = False)
1328
1329        # colorEditor0
1330        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1331        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor0")
1332        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1333        self.colorEditor0.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1334
1335        # colorEditor1
1336        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1337        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor1")
1338        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1339        self.colorEditor1.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1340
1341        # colorEditor2
1342        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1343        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor2")
1344        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1345        self.colorEditor2.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1346
1347        # colorEditor3

Comprehensive HDR image editing interface with all editing controls.

Provides the complete HDR editing interface with real-time preview and extensive parameter controls. Includes exposure, contrast, tone curves, color editing, geometry transformations, and HDR preview capabilities.

Layout Structure:

  • Top: Image preview showing real-time edits
  • Bottom: Scrollable controls panel with:
    • Basic adjustments (exposure, contrast, saturation)
    • Advanced tone curve with B-spline control points
    • Lightness masking for selective editing
    • Five independent color editors in LCH space
    • Automatic color selection tools
    • Geometry transformations (rotation, cropping)
    • HDR preview controls

Attributes: controller (EditImageController): Parent controller reference imageWidgetController (ImageWidgetController): Image preview controller exposure, contrast, saturation (AdvanceSliderController): Basic adjustment controls tonecurve (ToneCurveController): B-spline tone curve editor lightnessmask (LightnessMaskController): Tone range masking colorEditor0-4 (LchColorSelectorController): Independent color editors colorEditorsAuto (ColorEditorsAutoController): Automatic color selection geometry (GeometryController): Rotation and cropping controls hdrPreview (HDRviewerView): HDR display preview interface scroll (QScrollArea): Scrollable container for all controls

Methods: setImage: Update image preview display autoExposure: Trigger automatic exposure calculation changeExposure: Handle manual exposure adjustments autoContrast: Trigger automatic contrast calculation changeContrast: Handle manual contrast adjustments autoSaturation: Trigger automatic saturation calculation changeSaturation: Handle manual saturation adjustments plotToneCurve: Update tone curve visualization setProcessPipe: Initialize interface with ProcessPipe parameters

def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe): 
1285    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):
1286        """
1287        Initialize interface with ProcessPipe parameters.
1288        
1289        Recovers all editing parameters from the ProcessPipe and restores
1290        the interface state to match the current image's editing configuration.
1291        This method is called when switching between images to maintain
1292        consistent editing state.
1293        
1294        Args:
1295            processPipe (ProcessPipe): Processing pipeline with current parameters
1296        """
1297        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> EditImageView.setProcessPipe(",")")
1298
1299        # exposure
1300        # recover value in pipe and restore it
1301        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("exposure")
1302        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1303        self.exposure.setValue(value['EV'], callBackActive = False)
1304
1305        # contrast
1306        # recover value in pipe and restore it
1307        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("contrast")
1308        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1309        self.contrast.setValue(value['contrast'], callBackActive = False)
1310
1311        # tonecurve
1312        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1313        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
1314        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1315        self.tonecurve.setValues(value,callBackActive = False)
1316
1317        # lightnessmask
1318        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1319        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("lightnessmask")
1320        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1321        self.lightnessmask.setValues(value,callBackActive = False)
1322
1323        # saturation
1324        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1325        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("saturation")
1326        value = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1327        self.saturation.setValue(value['saturation'], callBackActive = False)
1328
1329        # colorEditor0
1330        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1331        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor0")
1332        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1333        self.colorEditor0.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1334
1335        # colorEditor1
1336        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1337        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor1")
1338        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1339        self.colorEditor1.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1340
1341        # colorEditor2
1342        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1343        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor2")
1344        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1345        self.colorEditor2.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1346
1347        # colorEditor3
1348        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1349        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor3")
1350        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1351        self.colorEditor3.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1352        
1353        # colorEditor4
1354        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1355        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("colorEditor4")
1356        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1357        self.colorEditor4.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)
1358        
1359        # geometry
1360        # recover data in pipe and restore it
1361        id = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("geometry")
1362        values = processPipe.getParameters(id)
1363        self.geometry.setValues(values, callBackActive = False)

class MultiDockView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDockWidget): 
1367class MultiDockView(QDockWidget):
1368    def __init__(self, _controller, HDRcontroller=None):
1369        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.__init__(",")")
1370
1371        super().__init__("Image Edit/Info")
1372        self.controller = _controller
1373
1374        self.setAllowedAreas(Qt.LeftDockWidgetArea | Qt.RightDockWidgetArea)
1375      
1376        self.childControllers = [
1377            controller.EditImageController(self, HDRcontroller), 
1378            controller.ImageInfoController(self), 
1379            controller.ImageAestheticsController(self)]
1380            #controller.ImageQualityController(self, HDRcontroller)]
1381        self.childController = self.childControllers[0]
1382        self.active = 0
1383        self.setWidget(self.childController.view)
1384        self.repaint()
1385    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1386    def switch(self,nb):
1387        """
1388            change active dock
1389            nb = 0 > editing imag dock
1390            nb = 1 > image info and metadata dock
1391            nb = 2 > image aesthetics model 
1392        """
1393        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.switch(",nb,")")
1394
1395        if nb != self.active:
1396     
1397            self.active = (nb)%len(self.childControllers)
1398            self.childController.view.deleteLater()
1399            self.childController = self.childControllers[self.active]
1400            # rebuild view 
1401            processPipe = self.controller.parent.imageGalleryController.getSelectedProcessPipe()
1402            self.childController.buildView(processPipe)
1403            self.setWidget(self.childController.view)
1404            self.repaint()
1405    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1406    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):
1407        if pref.verbose:  print(" [VIEW] >> MultiDockView.setProcessPipe(",processPipe.getImage().name,")")
1408        return self.childController.setProcessPipe(processPipe)

class LchColorSelectorView(PyQt5.QtWidgets.QFrame): 
1742class LchColorSelectorView(QFrame):
1743    """
1744    LCH color space selection and editing interface.
1745    
1746    Provides comprehensive color editing in LCH (Lightness, Chroma, Hue) space
1747    with visual color bars, range selection sliders, and targeted editing controls.
1748    Allows precise color selection and adjustment with real-time visual feedback.
1749    
1750    Color Selection Components:
1751    - Hue bar: Visual hue spectrum (0-360)
1752    - Chroma bar: Saturation/colorfulness visualization (0-100)
1753    - Lightness bar: Brightness visualization (0-100)
1754    - Range sliders: Min/max selection for each component
1755    
1756    Color Editing Components:
1757    - Hue shift: Rotate colors around hue wheel (-180 to +180)
1758    - Exposure: Brightness adjustment (-3 to +3 stops)
1759    - Contrast: Local contrast enhancement (-100 to +100)
1760    - Saturation: Colorfulness adjustment (-100 to +100)
1761    
1762    Additional Features:
1763    - Selection mask preview
1764    - Reset buttons for selection and editing parameters
1765    - Real-time color bar updates based on selection
1766    
1767    Layout Structure:
1768    +------------------------------------------+
1769    | Hue Chroma Lightness color selector      |
1770    +------------------------------------------+
1771    | [Hue Color Bar Visualization]           |
1772    | [Min Hue Slider] [Max Hue Slider]       |
1773    | [Selected Hue Range Bar]                |
1774    +------------------------------------------+
1775    | [Chroma Color Bar Visualization]        |
1776    | [Min Chroma Slider] [Max Chroma Slider] |
1777    +------------------------------------------+
1778    | [Lightness Color Bar Visualization]     |
1779    | [Min Light Slider] [Max Light Slider]   |
1780    +------------------------------------------+
1781    | [Reset Selection]                        |
1782    +------------------------------------------+
1783    | color editor: hue shift, exposure, contrast, saturation |
1784    | hue shift:  [slider] [value]            |
1785    | saturation: [slider] [value]            |
1786    | exposure:   [slider] [value]            |
1787    | contrast:   [slider] [value]            |
1788    | [x] show selection                       |
1789    | [Reset Edit]                             |
1790    +------------------------------------------+
1791    
1792    Attributes:
1793        controller (LchColorSelectorController): Parent controller reference
1794        imageHueController, imageSaturationController, imageLightnessController: Color bar displays
1795        imageHueRangeController: Selected hue range visualization
1796        sliderHueMin, sliderHueMax: Hue range selection sliders
1797        sliderChromaMin, sliderChromaMax: Chroma range selection sliders
1798        sliderLightMin, sliderLightMax: Lightness range selection sliders
1799        sliderHueShift, sliderExposure, sliderContrast, sliderSaturation: Editing controls
1800        valueHueShift, valueExposure, valueContrast, valueSaturation: Value displays
1801        checkboxMask: Selection mask preview toggle
1802        resetSelection, resetEdit: Reset buttons
1803    
1804    Methods:
1805        sliderHueChange: Handle hue range selection changes
1806        sliderChromaChange: Handle chroma range selection changes
1807        sliderLightnessChange: Handle lightness range selection changes
1808        sliderHueShiftChange: Handle hue shift editing changes
1809        sliderExposureChange: Handle exposure editing changes

2003    # callbacks
2004    def sliderHueChange(self):
2005        """
2006        Handle hue range selection changes and update visual feedback.
2007        
2008        Updates hue range visualization and chroma bar based on selected
2009        hue range, then notifies controller of the change.
2010        """
2011        hmin = self.sliderHueMin.value()
2012        hmax = self.sliderHueMax.value()
2013
2014        # redraw hue range and chroma bar
2015        hueRangeBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (hmin,hmax), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
2016        hueRangeBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueRangeBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2017        self.imageHueRangeController.setImage(hueRangeBarRGB)
2018        saturationBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (0,100), (hmin,hmax), (20,720), width='c', height='L')
2019        saturationBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(saturationBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2020        self.imageSaturationController.setImage(saturationBarRGB)
2021
2022        # call controller
2023        self.controller.sliderHueChange(hmin,hmax)
2024
2025    def sliderChromaChange(self):
2026        """Handle chroma range selection changes."""
2027        vmin = self.sliderChromaMin.value()
2028        vmax = self.sliderChromaMax.value()
2029        # call controller
2030        self.controller.sliderChromaChange(vmin,vmax)
2031
2032    def sliderLightnessChange(self):
2033        """Handle lightness range selection changes."""
2034        vmin = self.sliderLightMin.value()/3.0
2035        vmax = self.sliderLightMax.value()/3.0
2036        # call controller
2037        self.controller.sliderLightnessChange(vmin,vmax)
2038
2039    def sliderExposureChange(self):
2040        """Handle exposure editing changes with 0.1 stop precision."""
2041        ev = round(self.sliderExposure.value()/30,1)
2042        # force to 0.1 precision
2043        self.valueExposure.setText(str(ev))
2044        self.controller.sliderExposureChange(ev)
2045
2046    def sliderSaturationChange(self):
2047        """Handle saturation editing changes."""
2048        ev = self.sliderSaturation.value()
2049        self.valueSaturation.setText(str(ev))
2050        self.controller.sliderSaturationChange(ev)
2051
2052    def sliderContrastChange(self):
2053        """Handle contrast editing changes."""
2054        ev = self.sliderContrast.value()
2055        self.valueContrast.setText(str(ev))
2056        self.controller.sliderContrastChange(ev)
2057
2058    def sliderHueShiftChange(self):
2059        """Handle hue shift editing changes."""
2060        hs = self.sliderHueShift.value()
2061        self.valueHueShift.setText(str(hs))
2062        self.controller.sliderHueShiftChange(hs)
2063
2064    def checkboxMaskChange(self):
2065        """Handle selection mask preview toggle."""
2066        self.controller.checkboxMaskChange(self.checkboxMask.isChecked())

LCH color space selection and editing interface.

Provides comprehensive color editing in LCH (Lightness, Chroma, Hue) space with visual color bars, range selection sliders, and targeted editing controls. Allows precise color selection and adjustment with real-time visual feedback.

Color Selection Components:

  • Hue bar: Visual hue spectrum (0-360)
  • Chroma bar: Saturation/colorfulness visualization (0-100)
  • Lightness bar: Brightness visualization (0-100)
  • Range sliders: Min/max selection for each component

Color Editing Components:

  • Hue shift: Rotate colors around hue wheel (-180 to +180)
  • Exposure: Brightness adjustment (-3 to +3 stops)
  • Contrast: Local contrast enhancement (-100 to +100)
  • Saturation: Colorfulness adjustment (-100 to +100)

Additional Features:

  • Selection mask preview
  • Reset buttons for selection and editing parameters
  • Real-time color bar updates based on selection

Layout Structure: +------------------------------------------+ | Hue Chroma Lightness color selector | +------------------------------------------+ | [Hue Color Bar Visualization] | | [Min Hue Slider] [Max Hue Slider] | | [Selected Hue Range Bar] | +------------------------------------------+ | [Chroma Color Bar Visualization] | | [Min Chroma Slider] [Max Chroma Slider] | +------------------------------------------+ | [Lightness Color Bar Visualization] | | [Min Light Slider] [Max Light Slider] | +------------------------------------------+ | [Reset Selection] | +------------------------------------------+ | color editor: hue shift, exposure, contrast, saturation | | hue shift: [slider] [value] | | saturation: [slider] [value] | | exposure: [slider] [value] | | contrast: [slider] [value] | | [x] show selection | | [Reset Edit] | +------------------------------------------+

Attributes: controller (LchColorSelectorController): Parent controller reference imageHueController, imageSaturationController, imageLightnessController: Color bar displays imageHueRangeController: Selected hue range visualization sliderHueMin, sliderHueMax: Hue range selection sliders sliderChromaMin, sliderChromaMax: Chroma range selection sliders sliderLightMin, sliderLightMax: Lightness range selection sliders sliderHueShift, sliderExposure, sliderContrast, sliderSaturation: Editing controls valueHueShift, valueExposure, valueContrast, valueSaturation: Value displays checkboxMask: Selection mask preview toggle resetSelection, resetEdit: Reset buttons

Methods: sliderHueChange: Handle hue range selection changes sliderChromaChange: Handle chroma range selection changes sliderLightnessChange: Handle lightness range selection changes sliderHueShiftChange: Handle hue shift editing changes sliderExposureChange: Handle exposure editing changes sliderSaturationChange: Handle saturation editing changes sliderContrastChange: Handle contrast editing changes checkboxMaskChange: Handle mask preview toggle

2006        Handle hue range selection changes and update visual feedback.
2007        
2008        Updates hue range visualization and chroma bar based on selected
2009        hue range, then notifies controller of the change.
2010        """
2011        hmin = self.sliderHueMin.value()
2012        hmax = self.sliderHueMax.value()
2013
2014        # redraw hue range and chroma bar
2015        hueRangeBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (100,100), (hmin,hmax), (20,720), width='h', height='c')
2016        hueRangeBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(hueRangeBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2017        self.imageHueRangeController.setImage(hueRangeBarRGB)
2018        saturationBarLch = hdrCore.image.Image.buildLchColorData((75,75), (0,100), (hmin,hmax), (20,720), width='c', height='L')
2019        saturationBarRGB = hdrCore.processing.Lch_to_sRGB(saturationBarLch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=True)
2020        self.imageSaturationController.setImage(saturationBarRGB)
2021
2022        # call controller
2023        self.controller.sliderHueChange(hmin,hmax)

Image aesthetics analysis and color palette visualization interface.

Provides tools for analyzing image aesthetics including dominant color extraction, color palette generation, and visual composition analysis. Uses K-means clustering for color palette extraction with configurable parameters.

Layout Structure:

  • Top: Image preview showing current processing result
  • Bottom: Scrollable controls panel with:
    • Process output selector (which processing step to analyze)
    • Number of colors configuration (2-8 colors)
    • Generated color palette visualization

Analysis Features:

  • Dominant color extraction using K-means clustering
  • Configurable color count (2-8 dominant colors)
  • Process step selection for analysis input
  • Visual color palette representation
  • Extensible for composition and strength line analysis

Layout: +------------------------------------------+ | [Image Preview] | +------------------------------------------+ | color palette | | process output: [dropdown] | | number of colors: [spinbox] | | [Color Palette Visualization] | +------------------------------------------+

Attributes: controller (ImageAestheticsController): Parent controller reference imageWidgetController (ImageWidgetController): Main image display labelColorPalette: Color palette section label labelNodeSelector: Process output selection label nodeSelector (QComboBox): Process step selection dropdown labelColorsNumber: Color count configuration label nbColors (QSpinBox): Number of colors to extract (2-8) paletteImageWidgetController (ImageWidgetController): Color palette display scroll (QScrollArea): Scrollable container for controls

Methods: setProcessPipe: Update display with new ProcessPipe and color palette
